title: Herstellerversprechen vollständig eingehalten
review: Hierzu gibt es relativ wenig zu sagen. Alles, was BIC hier schreibt, stimmt und wurde vernünftig umgesetzt.- Ergonomisch und bequem dank Dreiecksform- Sehr stabile Mine, bei der ich keinen Bruch feststellen konnte- Kunstharz splittert nicht (wobei mir noch nie ein Bleistift auseinandergebrochen ist...)- Made in Europe (Frankreich), unterstützt also die lokale WirtschaftEinzig der Radiergummi am Ende ist, wie fast bei jedem Bleistift, etwas hart/spröde und radiert nicht so sauber wie man es sich wünscht. Hier habe ich aber noch keinen integrierten Radiergummi gefunden, der überzeugt.Oh, und das Anspitzen geht wegen Dreiecksform und Kunstharz nicht ganz so leicht von der Hand wie sonst.

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Liegen gut in der Hand, kräftiger Farbton
review: Getestet habe ich die BIC Evolution Triangle HB Dreikant Bleistifte mit Radiergummi im 12er Pack.Geliefert werden die Bleistifte in einer kleinen, überwiegend orangenen Papierverpackung.Die Bleistifte sind blau und dreieckig gestaltet. An der oberen Seite befindet sich ein kleiner Radiergummi, um kleine Korrekturen unmittelbar vornehmen zu können.Die Bleistifte liegen sehr gut in der Hand. Ich nutze sie überwiegend beim Lernen für mein Studium, um dort benötigte Zeichnungen anzufertigen (Graphen, Tabellen, etc.).Die Spitze des Bleistiftes ist sehr robust und hält lange. Auch nach dem Anspitzen bricht sie nicht direkt ab.Die Bleistifte sind kräftig, sodass man die gezogenen Linien, etc. auf Collegeblock Papier gut erkennen kann.Der Radiergummi ist für kleine Korrekturen sehr praktisch.Wenn man eine komplette Zeichnung radieren möchte, sollte man aber trotzdem zu einem größeren Radiergummi greifen.Zusammenfassend bin ich mit meinen neuen Bleistiften sehr zufrieden, da sie gut in der Hand liegen, kräftig und ergiebig sind, sowie einen kleinen Radiergummi enthalten. Deshalb von mir gerne die Höchstpunktzahl.

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12

title: Y ras
review: Ras

prod_name: Bic - Evolution Triangle - Triangular Pencils with Integrated Eraser - HB - Box of 12
title: Im Grunde toll
review: Die BIC Dreikant Bleistifte "Evolution" stellen erst auf den zweiten Blick eine neue Generation von Bleistiften dar.Das, was wie Holz aussieht, ist gar kein Holz, sondern Kunstharz.Den Unterschied spürt man weder beim Gebrauch, noch beim Spitzen, denn das ist alles wie gehabt.Die HB-Mine ist jedoch eine ganz normale Bleistiftmine von guter Qualität.Dass sie in der Kunstharzhülle besser geschützt ist, als in einer Holzhülle konnte ich bei normaler Verwendung nicht feststellen.Der Bleistiftköper ist mit blauem Metalliclack überzogen, sieht ganz schick aus.Am hinteren Ende befindet sich ein klassischer Aufsatz-Radiergummi in weiß. Wunder darf man von diesen Radiergummis nicht erwarten. Bei intensivem Gebrauch sind sie schnell aufgebraucht und nur noch die scharfkantige Blechhülle ist übrig und bei nur gelegentlichem Gebrauch verschmutzen und verfetten die Radiergummis und fangen an zu schmieren. Ich persönlich verwende stets einen ganz konventionellen Bleistift-Radiergummi in der gewohnten Riegelform.Trotzdem nur 4 Sterne, da mich im Angebotstext etwas wirklich stört.Da steht, dass beim Kauen auf dem Bleistift nichts absplittern kann.Also bitte. Man soll nicht auf dem Bleistift kauen! Und wer sich das wirklich nicht verkneifen kann, der ist mit einem nicht lackierten Echtholzbleistift bestimmt besser dran.Auf Kunstharz herumkauen? Wirklich??Wie auch immer, insgesamt ein ordentlicher Bleistift der seine erwartete Funktion hervorragend ausführt.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: My favourite Mechanical Pencil
review: This is my third pencil now of this model.My first one was stolen by my Sister. She had one herself, but she wanted to take mine on a University trip which involved a lot of time out in the field. When she got back, she conveniently lost 'my' pencil and not her own (I had grounds to believe that it was actually her pencil she lost - which I was eventually proved right when she confessed to her crime).Anyway, the tension got so heated at one point that she bought me a new one right there on the spot. I should add that this argument went on for months. I simple wanted a confession. That's how much these mechanical pencils mean to us!With my second copy, we went the distance together. What makes these pencils so great is that they just have this perfect weight and feel. It genuinely feels like quality and it's rare to find all of the graphite broken inside. You can really hit the darker tones of the HB quite effortlessly while being just as able to be used lightly and for speed taking notes.I used my first copy back when I was at University. I had to do a lot of technical drawings of architecture or infrastructure and I can honestly say that it always allowed me to deliver the quality of drawing that I had in mind. My second copy was mostly used for a lot of note-taking and the occasional drawing.My new copy, as displayed in the photograph, is mostly unused for now. I only bought this particular ASIN because it came with the additional graphite. This is only a couple of quid more expensive than just buying the supplies individually - so I figured why not have a backup!In any case, I am prepared this time if my Sister plans on another heist...
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2018

title: Staedtler non si discute
review: Staedtler è un monumento nel campo della cancelleria! credo che ognuno di noi abbia, almeno una volta, utilizzato una delle loro penne o matite e la qualità ovviamente è eccezionale. Questa penna portamine è solida e robusta: ergonomia, qualità dei materiali, robustezza. Sono le qualità principali di questo prodotto. Inoltre è anche bella esteticamente e appare a tutti gli effetti simile ad una penna. Consiglio vivamente quindi l'acquisto di questo prodotto e spero che questa recensione possa esservi utile ⬇️

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: 'Yer pays yer money and yer makes yer choice'
review:
I have been using mechanical pencils for many years, working my way through a number of brands, and the Staedtler Mars Micro is the best I have ever had. Its particularly strong features are its lead feed mechanism - which is firm and has never given me any trouble - and the comfortable rubberised grip towards the bottom of the barrel. For what it's worth, the pencil's appearance is distinctive too, and the metal pocket grip doesn't detach itself.I don't remember when I bought my first Staedtler, but think it must have been at least six years ago. I still have it, and have just bought three more, not because of any problems with the original, but because I have gradually lost some others that I had for different places, different pockets, etc.The leads that come with the pencil - sadly only three as a starter - are superior to own-brand replacements from stationery chains. So I have gone back to paying Staedtler's price for 12 
  
Staedtler Mars Micro Carbon 0.5mm HB Mechanical Pencil Lead







  
  
    , which is not much less than at least one chain's price for 40. Even in experienced hands (mine), the latter break frequently; if someone borrows the pencil they get frustrated because the cheap leads break repeatedly. Staedtler leads mostly don't.So yer pays yer money and yer makes yer choice - mine's a Staedtler.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 August 2014

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: La marque que je connais et utilise depuis l'enfance
review: Mon père était dessinateur dans une compagnie d'aviation et aussi dans le domaine personnel. C'est lui qui, il y a plus de 40 ans, m'a fait connaître les produits de cette marque.Je n'ai utilisé que des gommes de cette marque (à l'école comme à la maison) , des crayons à papier et porte-mine steadler. Désormais je continue à en acheter et pour ma fille de 7 ans, après avoir testé une marque magasin, je suis vite revenue à cette marque qui fait un excellent travail. Crayonnage, gommage et coloriages.... Je ne peux que recommander cette marque quelque soit le produit.J'ai acheté ce porte-mine sans me soucier d'une possible mésaventure et j'en suis ravie. Je n'ai aucun soucis.Les mines 0,5mm sont effectivement fines mais c'est ce que l'on recherche.Certaines, neuves, semblent effectivement ne pas faire le bon diamètre et sortent seules sur une partie de la mine.... Un défaut à la conception peut-être ?Ça ne me dérange pas. Je vais d'ailleurs acheter la version 0.7 (les miens ayant été depuis longtemps égarés après plusieurs déménagements.)Je recommande ce produit !Il fonctionne parfaitement et c'est plutôt la gomme qui s'use dans le temps.... J'ai d'ailleurs fait des recherche avec la référence des recharges, nom de la marque etc sans succès et c'est en posant la question que j'ai pu avoir le lien en moins de 24h pour les recharges de gommes par la marque ! (quand même étrange de ne pas avoir trouvé malgré la référence !https://www.amazon.fr/gp/offer-listing/B001IVXJIA/ref=dp_olp_NEW_mbc?ie=UTF8&condition=NEWJe les commande de suite !

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: Não se deixe levar pela embalagem
review: Vem num saquinho, mas a qualidade é ótima. Comprei também os grafites da marca e são de ótima qualidade. Já quero a 0.7

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: La mejor
review: Tuve una igual que me duró 1 año usándola todos los días. Me gustó tanto que he repetido la compra. He de decir que la anterior la cambié porque me cayó y la pisé sin querer. Anteriormente había utilizado de Rotring que aunque no es mala, no tiene la punta retráctil y finalmente la goma de agarre se acabó rompiendo poco a poco en pedacitos. También tuve una Faber-Caster de punta retráctil que es bastante similar a la Staedler.Ésta tiene un agarre firme y ergonómico, con goma suave en la punta. Al escribir, no resbala ni gira.En mi caso, tengo la mala costumbre de hacer demasiada fuerza al escribir por lo que las minas de 0,5 las devoro, teniendo que usar en una lapicera normal minas de 0,7 mm. Con ellas el trazo para escritura en mi opinión queda demasiado ancho y ensucia mucho el papel. Gracias a portaminas como esta y su punta retráctil, puedo utilizar minas de 0,5 porque ese movimiento de muelle que tiene en la punta absorbe la fuerza que hago de más.Otra cosa que debo decir es que, si tienes la técnica de girar la lapicera a la vez que vas escribiendo para ir afilando la mina, con este portaminas puedes hacerlo de forma cómoda gracias al agarre simétrico que tiene.Así que estoy encantado con ella y si estás buscando un portaminas de calidad a un buen precio, yo no me lo pensaría más, es la tuya.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: sehr guter Bleistift
review: Qualität ist super.Das Radiergummi und der Verschluss gehen sehr schwer raus, also keine Angst vor Verlust der Minen.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: Loved it so much I bought it twice!
review: Absolutely loved this mechanical pencil, I sadly lost the original one and didn't need to think twice before buying a second one. (I found the first one so now I have two!)The quality is great and the lead is strong but not too brittle. The pencil is not as dark as other HB pencils, which isn't really a problem for me as I use it for technical drawings rather than shading. After about a years use the silver painting on my pencil began to wear away, but that is the only difference between this one and my old one.My only problem with the product is the lead refill. The price of the product is great as the refill on its own is a good percentage of the price of the pen with the refill included. However the little tube the lead is in is not very secure. I left it in a small pencil case and after a few weeks the lid had fallen out and my refills had all been smashed to pieces. I was a little disappointed by this as I had been using cheap lead refills when doing sketches and using the staedtler lead sparingly, and as mentioned before the refills on their own are quite expensive, but worth it considering how many other wooden pencils I would have gone through had I not switched to mechanical.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 June 2017

prod_name: STAEDTLER 7755ABK25D Mars Micro Mechanical Pencil, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 1 + 12 HB Lead Refills)
title: Feine Stärke
review: Bei Notizen ist 0,7mm leider zu dick, daher wollte ich einen neuen Druckbleistift mit einer Stärke von 0,5mm. Da ich bei Schreiben den Stift nicht genau senkrecht sondern etwas schräg halte, nutzt sich die Mine natürlich auch schräg ab, was zu einer dickeren Schrift führt. Bei 0,7mm wurde das schnell unordentlich. Mit dieser Mine ist es aber genau richtig.Der Stift ist gut verarbeitet und liegt auch gut in der Hand. Wichtiges Kaufargument war für mich aber auch der Preis, der hier viel niederiger lag als im Geschäft. Da habe ich ein schönes Schnäppchen gemacht.

title: Prodotto di ottima qualità e duraturo, peccato per la pesantezza durante l'uso prolungato!
review: Prodotto usato per effettuare disegni tecnici, i materiali sono resistenti ed infatti dopo anni non presenta particolari segni di usura tranne la scritta "Staedtler" parzialmente cancellata. Sottile e resa ergonomica e più comoda dall'impugnatura gommata. Il sistema di scorrimento della mina è ottimo e non ha mai dato problemi, la gomma posta superiormente per me è risultata essere sempre molto utile e pratica. Unica nota negativa è la pesantezza del metallo che ho percepito in particolar modo durante l'uso prolungato.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Goldfaber Artists' Graphite 4B Pencil
title: Deceptive product Photo
review: I placed an order for this product on September 4, 2013, one day before the review by another customer thinking that we were getting a package of 8 HB pencils.  I am absolutely disgusted that Amazon would show such a photo when there was only a single pencil.  Shame on you Amazon....  I have done a lot of business with Amazon over the years and I have never had a product misrepresented like this.  I hope that Amazon would forward an apology to those who have ordered this and make good and send to us the other 7 pencils shown and make sure that this does not happen again!Feel betrayed!

title: Attention à la photo de présentation
review: J'ai cliqué sur "acheter" un peu vite (je fais confiance à cette marque) et n'ai pas fait attention à la quantité. Il y a un seul crayon et non deux, la photo de présentation est donc trompeuse. Tant pis pour moi. Ceci étant dit, je suis très contente de ce crayon. Il glisse bien, c'est très agréable de dessiner avec, il se gomme bien, et on peut facilement jouer sur l'intensité de la couleur et la taille du trait en variant la pression.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Goldfaber Artists' Graphite 4B Pencil
title: Deceptive product Photo
review: I placed an order for this product on September 4, 2013, one day before the review by another customer thinking that we were getting a package of 8 HB pencils.  I am absolutely disgusted that Amazon would show such a photo when there was only a single pencil.  Shame on you Amazon....  I have done a lot of business with Amazon over the years and I have never had a product misrepresented like this.  I hope that Amazon would forward an apology to those who have ordered this and make good and send to us the other 7 pencils shown and make sure that this does not happen again!Feel betrayed!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 September 2013

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Por no más de 7-10 €, un portaminas de gama media-baja fiable, versátil, cómodo y elegante.
review: Por mecanismo interno, tengo desde hace años un primo de este, el Grip 2011 también en 0,7 mm.  Con tan buena opinión de este Grip Plus quería tenerlo y probarlo a buen precio.Lo que digo en el título lo cumple. Es un portaminas con buena prestancia pese a ser de plástico (hasta el clip), y se siente estupendamente en la mano. También tiene pinta metálica (como si fuera la de un bolígrafo) retráctil  y con amortiguación para proteger la mina de rotura (como todos los Grip).Pero es mejorable.No hay que pagar en exceso por él, pues es un portaminas muy de plástico, llegando incluso al mecanismo interno (el embrague y garras que sujetan y gestionan el avance de la mina son en plástico, no de latón).  Está fabricado en Japón, lo que es una garantía.Y por esto último es mejorable.  Este portaminas tiene varios primos-hermanos bajo diferentes marcas con leves diferencias estéticas.  Por lo que tengo entendido, el diseño base y general lo fabrica el grupo Kotobuki ('Kotobuki Group').  Varios de sus primos (de los que por las normas, no mencionaré marcas ni modelos) optan por ejemplo por un clip metálico, que creo que es más conveniente para este estilo de portaminas, y lo haría más duradero (no obstante el Grip 2011, o el más delgado y también de fabricación japonesa, Grip 1345, tienen clips metálicos).  Cuidad del de plástico, que son más propensos a romper.Viene envuelto en un par de bolsitas de plástico transparente, una de ellas hermética del tipo 'zip'.  Quizás algo escaso de protección. También viene cargado con 5 minas de la casa, creo que en dureza 2B.  Blandas, muy suaves, y bastante apropiadas para escribir con estos portaminas aprovechando el contar con la mina amortiguada ante excesos de presión contra el papel.Los colores son preciosos, por otros productos de la casa que comparten los de este modelo, lo sé.  No decepcionará ninguno, todos muy elegantes y aptos para toda ocasión y uso.  Y este rojo granate tampoco es la excepción, le queda espectacular.Pese a los puntos mejorables, no obstante, es bastante recomendable.  Es normal que tenga buena fama.  Así que si te hace tilín y está a buen precio o quieres darte el capricho, aprieta el gatillo.  No creo que te decepcione.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Portamine molto ben progettata
review: Ottimo prodotto, ben bilanciato e super stabile, la mina non si sposta mentre si scrive e la gomma integrata è molto comoda. Super consigliata ✨

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Very Good Quality - Worth a Few Dollars More
review: I had been using the Papermate "Titanium" series pencils for many years and was satisfied.  I happened to see these Faber-Castell pencils online and was intrigued by the photo.  I bought the blue, red, and blackberry with .7mm lead.  These pencils are definitely a step up in quality.  They are engineered with a superior ergonomic grip, a long twist-up eraser, and very stable tip.  The lead that came with them has just the right hardness and writes smoothly.  I like the larger diameter of the pencil, and the thin band of metal that is visible above the grip is a nice visual accent.  The colored barrels are plastic but the pencil has sufficient weight from the lower metal portion.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 September 2015

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Excelente portaminas 0.7.
review: De los mejores útiles de escritura que podrás tener. Un portaminas excelente. Es ligero, ergonómico (el agarre en la zona de goma es ideal) y de calidad. El grosor 0.7 es ideal al ser algo mas resistente la mina y disponer una amortiguación por muelle, ambas características facilitan algo mas de presión para los subrayados y los trazos más nítidos en la escritura en diferencia de un grosor menor con 0.5. Si no te importa el detalle del color (te envían un color aleatorio, no se puede elegir) por el mismo coste de un solo portaminas, obtienes también un respuesto de goma y minas B. Lleva en su blister cerrado perfecto. A mi parecer es una genial opción de compra. En mi caso me remitieron el color azul que se ve en la imagen.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Calidad excepcional a un precio increíble, ergonómico y cómodo de usar.
review: El mejor portaminas que he encontrado en el mercado. Lo uso para dibujo artístico, para escribir, para tomar apuntes..para cualquier cosa. Pensé que no me serviría para dibujar puesto que las misnas pone que son HB, pero son bastante blanditas y puedes hacer con ellas lo que quieras. Difícil de partir también.Al ser portaminas con goma, las gomitas son pequeñas, pero por unos 3€ en Amazon podéis compraros un recambio con 3 formas extra. Duran muchísimo así que merecen la pena. Borran fenomenal y es comodísimo escribir, y solo dando la vuelta al portaminas, borrar en segundos el fallo que hayas cometido. Porque borran realmente bien!Faber Castell nunca decepciona y el precio de este portaminas en concreto (comparados con otros de la misma marca o incluso de otras mucho peores en calidad...) es muy bueno!Si el otro día me compré uno del mismo tipo (por capricho) marca Milán en el bazar chino de mi casa y además de que ya se me ha roto la tapa de la goma (este modelo traía tapón para el borrador) las minas son durísimas, se parten a la mínima presión, la goma si borra bien, eso es cierto, y me costó 3€!! Éste me costó 6!No recomendaría otro, a no ser que lo queráis para dibujo técnico, que entonces hay otros más especificos....Ah! Parece que es gordito y va a ser incomodo al uso, pero para nada. Es ergonómico y se adapta perfectamente a la escritura/bibujo o para bocetos incluso. También puedes comprar después recambios de minas de la dureza que quieras, así que no le veo ningún contra.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: and I loved it. Recently I came to the States
review: I have been using this pencil for ten years. My mother gave me one ,which was blue, ten years ago during my high-school exams, and I loved it. Recently I came to the States, and I left my pencil home, so I reordered the same pencil but different color (Red, which is even nicer in real) . I fall in love with it each time I use it. The grip is so comfy,  it looks very nice  and its very comfortable while writing. The tip is durable, its metal so it lasts for ever if you take good care of it. The eraser is also great . Love it and I highly recommend it if you love writing using pencils. It worth every penny!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 November 2017

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: De los mejores portaminas que he tenido y muy cómodo
review: Al principio puede resultar algo gordo en la mano peor al momento se adapta muy bien a la mano y resulta cómodo, ni demasiado ligero ni excesivamente pesado. El mecanismo funciona perfectamente y sin fallos y el sistema de la goma es muy práctico, a rosca para poder extraer o guardar al gusto. Además la goma borra, cosa que no todos los portaminas con goma incorporada hacen bien.En el paquete viene el portaminas con su goma, otra goma de repuesto y un estuche de minas 0,7 B.Por ponerle un pero, no se puede elegir color. Estaría bien que se diera la opción de elegir. En la foto aparece un portaminas negro. Pero me ha llegado en color granate, precioso, pero ya tenía  otro en ese color y esperaba uno negro. De todas formas no me importa tener dos iguales porque son estupendos.

title: Sehr guter Druckbleistift
review: Ich benutze Stifte dieses Typs schon seit Jahren und bin sehr zufrieden. Deshalb für den Stift selbst volle 5 Sterne. Abzug von einem Stern deshalb, da der Stift nicht mehr in einer Blisterverpackung inclusive eines Ersatzradiergummis geliefert wird, sondern verpackungslos mit einem Aufkleber, der sich absolut schlecht ablösen lässt und eine hässliche Kleberschicht zurück lässt. Diese ist wiederum nur mit viel Mühe entfernbar. Sicherlich ist es notwendig, bei Verpackungsmüll Einsparungen vorzunehmen, aber bitte nicht so primitiv für ein hochwertiges und auch nicht ganz billiges Produkt!

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: My new favorite mechanical pencil.
review: I love mechanical pencils. This one has everything I like. I mostly do design and illustration. I like a strong line. This pencil uses a .7mm lead. I have long fingers and find the thicker barrel of this pencil to be very comfortable. The eraser is soft and large.I like this pencil SO much that I have ordered it twice. You have a choice of barrel colors—and they're not kids' primary colors. The jewel tone colors make this pencil look like it should cost more than it does.Faber-Castell is a quality company and this is a quality pencil.

Unlike my previous favorites, the Uniball Shalaku pencils, these do not get dirty due to their transparent plastic bodies. And the best part? They’re not expensive at all!If you’re a heavy user of pencils, like I am, I’d highly recommend these. Durable, cheap and of great quality.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Perfekt für mich
review: Der Druckbleistift von Bic gefällt mir viel besser als die bisher benutzten normalen Bleistifte. Das ist zum einen das feine Schriftbild, das ich konstant erzeugen kann, in dem ich den Bleistift immer mal wieder drehe. Spitzen ist natürlich nicht erforderlich und wenn ich mich mal verschrieben habe, kann ich das blitzschnell mit dem integrierten Radiergummi korrigieren. Wenn man diesen vorsichtig herausdreht, finde man auch die beiden Ersatzminen.Durch einfaches Drücken wird die Mine weiter herausgeschoben und bleibt dann auch draußen. Zurück kann man sie nicht drücken, wenn man zu oft gedrückt hat, bedeutet das eine weit herausstehende Mine, die man dann vorsichtig runterschreiben sollte. Deshalb finde ich die Stifte für unterwegs nicht so gut geeignet. An der Seite befindet sich ein Clip, damit kann ich den Stift sehr gut an meinem Block befestigen.Ich habe die Stifte in 2 verschiedenen Minenstärken ausprobiert, kann da jetzt aber keine gravierenden Unterschiede feststellen. In beiden Stärken kann ich sehr fein schreiben.Ich werde die Stifte definitiv nachkaufen, aber das wird noch lange dauern, denn selbst ein Vielschreiber wie ich wird ewig mit den Stiften auskommen.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Amazing
review: Great pencils just what I was looking for definitely recommend

title: Lot de 5 porte-mines BIC Matic
review: Le diamètre 0,7mm de la mine HB et la présence de la gomme à l'autre extrémité du porte-mine rendent son utilisation pratique et agréable. Le bon maintien en main et sa légèreté constituent également un atout.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: liegen sehr gut in der Hand
review: Ich nutze sehr gerne Bleistifte wenn ich schreibe oder auch wenn es mal Malen nach Zahlen sein soll und mit den normalen Bleistiften kann man oft gerade bei Malen nach Zahlen einfach nicht alles sauber zeichnen und deshalb war ich auf der Suche nach einem Druckbleistift der recht günstig ist und wenn möglich sehr leicht in der Hand liegt damit es nicht so schwer fürs Handgelenk ist auf Dauer.Dieses Set hier umfasst fünf Stifte die eben so sortiert sind wie sie von der Maschine gepackt werden bei mir waren eben nicht alle Clipfarben dabei und zwei Farben waren doppelt aber es gibt schlimmeres.Der Stift liegt gut in der Hand und die Minen an sich sind sehr ergiebig und man muss nicht oft die Mine nachdrücken was ich als sehr positiv finde und ja da drei Minen in einem Stift enthalten sind, denke ich auch dass diese doch recht lange halten werden.Der Radiergummi welches am Ende des Stiftes angebracht ist, ist auch sehr gut und radiert alles streifenfrei weg und von daher konnte mich der Stift vollkommen überzeugen.Sehr gerne vergebe ich alle fünf Sterne für das Set Druckbleistifte.

review: Como "pega" podría decir que pesa si estas acostumbrado a los típicos bolis de publicidad, pero no nos engañemos tienen en cuenta que casi todas la piezas son de metal es un peso mas que aceptable a demás da como mas de "conciencia" de que tienes el lápiz cogido. prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The last pencil you’ll need
review: Ho utilizzato la matita in questione (rotring 800 mina 0,7) per un paio di settimane al lavoro tutto il giorno come unico strumento di scrittura e disegno (oltre che a casa per diletto o per prendere qualche appunto a caso) e quindi mi sento pronto a dare un mio parere. Sono un impiegato tecnico (ingegnere civile) in uno studio di ingegneria, quindi per una cosa o per l'altra in studio scrivo o faccio qualche schizzo prettamente a matita, per abitudine soprattutto, ma è per dire che ho modo di usarla molto la matita. L'oggetto in questione è costruito in modo impeccabile, veramente bella ed elegante e trasmette veramente solidità, più di quanto mi aspettassi. Il meccanismo di estrazione della punta funziona bene, l'estrazione della mina per esigenze costruttive non è la più appagante che abbia mai provato (ma va benissimo) e il tutto funzione senza incertezze. La cosa che più mi spaventava era il peso, perchè gia in passato passando dal classico porta mine economico di plastica a questi in metallo il limite che alla fine mi aveva fatto tornare ai primi è il peso, che con un uso intenso dopo un pò stanza veramente. In questo caso, seppur la matita non sia sicuramente leggera, anzi, il fatto che si riesca a impugnare molto vicino alla punta fa si che non si percepisca molto il suo peso in mano e quindi devo dire che alla fine non mi stanca particolarmente nella scrittura (nel disegno di solito si avverte meno la cosa per il movimento più lento). Riguardo al presunto problema del puntale che traballa nella sua sede essendo estraibile devo dire che durante l'utilizzo veramente bisogna impegnarsi sul serio per riuscire a percepire qualcosa, per me non sussiste proprio come impedimento, anche se sicuramente rispetto alla sua sorella inore con punta fissa o a una qualsiasi altra matita meccanica senza punta estraibile se si va a giocare col dito sulla punta non trasmette la stessa fermezza dell'elemento. In conclusione devo dire che sono soddisfatto della matita, sono contento di essermi levato questo sfizio, perchè di sfizio si tratta, dato che il prezzo è sicuramente elevato se pensiamo che è una matita meccanica e non è che rispetto a quelle da 5 euro vadda chissà quanto meglio, si scrive pressoché uguale, l'unica differenza è la piacevole sensazione che ragala come strumento più esclusivo e di estetica e dato che la amtita la uso tutto il giorno volevo togliermi lo sfizio di averne una che mi piacesse tanto.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Ein Meisterwerk der Präzision und Haptik, trotz des Preises
review: While this is a premium product and an intimidating price tag for a mechanical pencil, this product is beautiful and meticulously designed.ProsThe retractable tip helps prevent the tip from being bent and breaking, unlike all other pencils with this design.The grip is excellent and the weight distribution allows it to sit comfortably in the hand.This product is of a high quality and I have not experienced a mechanical failure for the three pencils I own in over 5 years.Neutral / preferenceThis pencil is nearly entirely made of metal; as such, it is very heavy. Personally, this is a pro and makes it feel like a quality product.ConsYou may as well assume that this thing doesn’t come with an eraser, just a lead stopper.If you get a ding on the pencil, the paint will be removed and exposed the raw metal beneath (eye sore for perfectionists).Due to the heavy weight, this pencil is difficult to write quickly with or do pencil tricks with.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 November 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Premium pencil!!!
review: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Ich habe den rOtring 800 Druckbleistift mit Einzug in der 0,7 mm Variante in Schwarz erworben und bin absolut begeistert von diesem Stift.Die Mechanik dieses Druckbleistifts ist einfach herausragend. Die einfahrbare Spitze ist nicht nur praktisch, sondern verleiht dem Stift auch eine zusätzliche Eleganz. Die Präzision beim Schreiben ist beeindruckend, und die 0,7 mm Mine ermöglicht ein sauberes und genaues Schriftbild.Die Haptik des rOtring 800 ist erstklassig. Das Gewicht des Stifts liegt angenehm in der Hand, und die Griffigkeit ist perfekt. Man spürt sofort, dass hier hochwertige Materialien verwendet wurden, was dem Stift eine robuste und langlebige Qualität verleiht.Obwohl der Preis dieses Druckbleistifts etwas höher ist, ist er meiner Meinung nach jeden Cent wert. Die Qualität und das Design rechtfertigen den Preis voll und ganz. Der rOtring 800 ist nicht nur ein Schreibgerät, sondern auch ein Hingucker auf meinem Schreibtisch. Die schwarze Farbe verleiht ihm eine zeitlose Eleganz.Insgesamt bin ich äußerst zufrieden mit meinem Kauf und kann den rOtring 800 Druckbleistift allen empfehlen, die nach einem hochwertigen und präzisen Schreibinstrument suchen – vorausgesetzt, der Preis spielt keine allzu große Rolle.Unter anderen kann ich auch die Kugelschreiberversion dergleichen Linie ,dem ich auch in Besitz habe genauso bedenkenlos empfehlen.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Me encanta
review: Excellent build (premium quality!!!). Got a black one, love the color scheme (with Gold tip). Retractable tip feature is very helpful (if you have the habit of dropping things!)Very happy that I bought it!!!!

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Good Quality
review: Antes que nada. Es cierto. La punta baila un poco y puede que necesites cinta adhesiva para solucionarlo (vaya que sirve). Fuera de eso, es el lapicero más hermoso del mundo. Solo verlo me hace olvidar sus detalles. Me encantó. Aparte ni dibujo, no me voy a poner de especialito.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: De lo mejor que e comprado en escritura  y en amazon
review: It is great for artist and engineers.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 December 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: NA
review: Todo ok perfecto,  recomiendo, lo mejor que esconde las puntas de las minas tanto del bolígrafo y del lápiz

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Excelente
review: Un producto para mi opinión de calidad, llego en buen estado y sin defectos ni desperfectos.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Nice but…
review: I bought this pencil to round out my ROtring collection… the Rapid Pro, Newton, 600, and now the 800.  Of pencils, I prefer the Rapid Pro for EDC.The 800 has a retractable tip, but it’s almost 1/2” long.  The thicker base is about 1/4” and the part that hold the lead is 1/4”.  And the twist then click motion to begin writing is excessive.The 600’s tip doesn’t retract so it can easily be damaged if dropped or mishandled.I have what I believe is a Newton pencil… it only says ROTRING on the barrel and has a smooth, not checkered grip.  This also has a retracting tip, but I prefer the checkered grip.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 October 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Un très bel objet à surveiller toutefois
review: La finition du produit est très bonne.Seul bémol, le mécanisme permettant de rétracter se bloque des fois à mi course apparemment en fonction des séries.Il est nécessaire de le manipuler plusieurs fois pour que les choses rentrent dans l'ordre.Je recommande du 2B pour l'utiliser correctement.Après quelques mois d'utilisation (mars 2019), le porte mine est bloqué...envoi au SAV de Rotring et réponse => produit non réparable dans le cadre de la garantie.Résultat ==> Je déconseille FORTEMENT ce modèle.Après quelques semaines, le SAV de Rotring m'a remplacé le modèle par un neuf. Suite à de nombreuses correspondances.Pensez à utiliser la garantie internationale et passer par le site Rotring !Depuis le remplacement plus aucun problème et c'est un très bel outil d'écriture.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Cool pencil
review: It’s a bit finicky at times to retract, but I like how it works. A tiny bit of play in the mechanism when writing. I can see how some might not like that but I don’t notice. My buddy dropped his on the unretracted end and the mechanism was kaput, but the manufacturer cheerfully replaced the pencil for free.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Llegó en buen tiempo y tiene buena apariencia
review: Tiene bonito acabado, pero el mecanismo para sacar la punta mediante un giro, se percibe delicado.....a ver qué tanto dura

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Hält wohl Jahre
review: Also die Qualität ist wirklich gut. Wenn man auf den Stift aufpasst, wird man den wohl ein paar Jahre haben, auch wegen der einfahrbaren Spitze. die erste Mine ging nicht durch, da musst ich bissl nachhelfen. Aber jetzt schiebt er nach wie es sein soll.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Most beautiful and well designed tool on my desk.
review: Without doubt, the best mechanical pencil I have ever bought. In fact I would go as far as to say it is the best writing tool I have ever purchased.The build quality is flawless. Solid metallic components everywhere. Really solid mechanism for revealing and retracting the tip.Loading can be a little fiddly and frustrating but this has been the case for every mechanical pencil I have ever had.I previously had one of these but the tip was bent by someone whilst I was away from my desk. Either that or the product failed. Replacement works just as well.Recommend the 0.7 over the 0.5 as 0.5mm Lead is very fragile and I found it breaks frequently.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 August 2016

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: OK pencil, but needs some mechanical tweaks
review: A great pencil, but the tip needs to be tightened regularly, and the lead doesn't always feed properly.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Calidad
review: El precio puede parecer elevado, pero la calidad y diseño están a la altura. Muy buen portaminas

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Broke after a month.
review: I have owned a variety of mechanical pencils, ranging from cheap to expensive brands, and most have lasted me 18+ years. I decided to give this brand a try after it was highly recommended, but unfortunately, it stopped working after only a month. The twisting mechanism at the top does not function properly, and the tip does not stay steady enough for me to write a single letter. I am baffled and don’t even know how this could have happened. Truthfully, a $0.99 mechanical pencil is more reliable and lasts longer than this supposedly well-known product. It has been an absolute waste of time and money. I even tried to fix it without success. The bottom line is that I will never purchase anything from this brand again. I had high hopes and was enthusiastic about the product, but unfortunately, it has been nothing but a disappointment and an absolute waste of money. Thank you.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2024

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: rOring 800 is Awesome!
review: The rOring 800 is awesome. The negative reviews that say there is some tip wobble are way over blown on this aspect. There is a very little bit of wobble as there has to be in a moving part. This is consistent as I have several of these for my work. They all have the same amount of tip wobble.  Those reviewers who have such an issue with this aspect never actually discuss how the pencil performs tip wobble or not. In practice the minuscule tip wobble is simply not an issue. It is an outstanding pencil. I am an artist and use it all the time as well as the rOtring 600 and Graphgear 1000. These all have their strengths and purpose as do other pencils...even the wooden ones. The 800 is a wonderful tool and built extremely well and the retractable tip works as it should and makes this a travel friendly alternative to the 600. And ...it is a pencil folks...write with it, draw with it, enjoy it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 April 2021

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: fancy but...
review: very nice quality.  But it has one fatal flaw, it does not hold the lead properly,  every time you write it pushes back.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Cinco de cinco
review: El detalle de los remates dorados (unido a la solidez del cuerpo metálico y el aire high-tech de la punta que se esconde) hace de esta pieza algo diferente. Tengo la formidable 600, pero esta es imprescindible. Ideal para tomar notas.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Precisión
review: Excelente instrumento de escritura. Como lo ha venido haciendo Rotring desde hace mucho tiempo este instrumento se mantiene impecable como compoenente esencial de un escritorio  y por supuesto de los amantes de la escritura a mano. No decepciona.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The sliding collar tolerance is, unfortunately, abysmal.
review: I really, really really wanted to like this pencil due to the retractable tip and ability to carry it around without worry. Unfortunately the amount of play in the tip is so great that it simply can't be ignored. I read a ton of reviews , watched loads of videos and bought this thinking that it can't be as bad as people made out in certain reviews but it unfortunately is.There is absolutely no reason why a pencil that clearly has top end machining and solidity elsewhere in the body has such an unacceptable amount of play in the KEY part of the pencil. To be clear, the part that extends and retracts has visible and very noticeable radial play between it and the section it slides up and down in to the point that it audibly clacks when you're writing with it. It should be approaching an interference fit and be absolutely solid as a fixed tip for something that costs as much as it does.It's current lax production format may be fine for casual writers and people coming to it green with few expectations or less demanding technical/precision needs but when you compare it to its fixed tip sibling, the 600, or the literal solid and precise, bones of your hand extension that the Pentel P205 is and writes like (still in my humble opinion the greatest mechanical pencil on the planet today), the difference is night and day.Can't recommend this at all and if you're thinking about it, I'd say buy the 600 in the tip diameter you want without any worries and buy yourself another four P205s with the money saved and fit a variety of different hardness leads in them for fun and variety. You'll be infinitely happier and better equipped in day to day pencil options.Sorry Rotring. For this to be your flagship pencil, you really should be doing better. Either sort your sliding mechanism tolerances out or add a sexy screw on cap to the 600, charge a fiver more for it and dump the 800.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 September 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: ... the Rotring 800 I wasn't sure that I would like this pencil
review: Reading the mixed reviews on the Rotring 800 I wasn't sure that I would like this pencil. Also looking at the photos I thought the gold accents looked cheap. In person this pencil looks anything but cheap. The gold, black and red is truly nice together. The Rotring 800 looks like a quality instrument. When you pick it up and start to write it’s even better. The mechanism that extends the sleeve has a satisfied spring. The pencil is well balanced and nicely weighted. One of the main concerns people have with the 800 is the sleeve. There is a little bit of movement. This is true but not enough for me to complain. I work in the interior design industry and hand draw floor plans for carpets, rugs and furniture. I also take notes and write quotes with the Rotring. That little bit of movement has not affected my experience with the pencil. I need to be able to carry the pencil in my shirt pocket or planner as well. The retractable sleeve was the deciding factor to pick the 800 over the 600.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 October 2017

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Sturdy
review: I love it, but wish I had spent the extra couple of quid on the version with the touchscreen stylus
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 December 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Hochwertige Verarbeitung, aber Extraminen sind ein muss
review: Ich möchte meine Erfahrungen mit dem rOtring 800 Druckbleistift mit Einzug und einer Stärke von 0,7 mm teilen, um Ihnen bei Ihrer Kaufentscheidung zu helfen.Zunächst einmal überzeugt der rOtring 800 Druckbleistift durch seine ausgezeichnete Qualität. Die Verarbeitung ist hochwertig und erfüllt alle Erwartungen, die man an einen rOtring-Bleistift stellen kann.Ein Problem trat jedoch bei den mitgelieferten Minen auf. In meinem Fall waren einige der Minen bereits bei der Lieferung gebrochen. Das ist natürlich nicht ideal und bedeutet zusätzlichen Aufwand für den Austausch.Dennoch bleibt der rOtring 800 Druckbleistift ein qualitativ hochwertiges Schreibgerät. Ich hoffe, diese Informationen sind hilfreich für Ihre Kaufentscheidung.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The best pencil
review: This is the best pencil money can buy. Super comfortable and a joy to use.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 January 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: La qualité Rotring
review: J'avais déjà le stylo bille de cette série, je l'utilise avec une pointe Gel Parker.Ce porte-mine 0,7 de la gamme Rotring 800 est son parfait compagnon.Il est très agréable d'utiliser des instruments d'écriture d'une telle qualité de fabrication.Note : la mine, comme sur le stylo bille, sort et rentre dans son logement en tournant le haut du stylo.Bien protégée lorsqu'elle est rentrée.Un peu cher, mais la qualité est là. Incontestablement.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Maravilloso
review: Fue para un regalo y acerté

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Perfecto
review: El portaminas es una pasada, lo compré para regalárselo a un buen amigo que es ilustrador, y le encantó. Y eso que es muy exigente con sus materiales. El mejor portaminas, puede que parezca un poco caro pero lo merece.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Great Pencil
review: As a drafter/designer I love the feel of this pencil.  Pure quality!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Lead Diameter fussy
review: Great engineering pencil , with one tiny flaw . The one I have hates lead that is 0.69 dia  (in a typical pack you will have a tolerance range of 0.68-0.71mm ) and this pencil has a grip intolerance  :-) other than having to mic a few leads to get this one to work , it is my go to pencil for life
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 December 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Le porte mine est bien mais les consommables sont introuvables
review: Le porte mine est de bonne qualité, c'est agréable, on sent que l'objet est qualitatif avec des mines de qualité on sent la différence !Mais le gros problème c'est les accessoires et les consommables (la gomme en particulier) c'est introuvable en France et hors de prix à l'import ! J'ai mon porte mine sans gomme, ça fait vraiment ridicule pour le prix que ça coûte.Je vous conseil donc de vous tourner vers un produit tout aussi qualitatif dont la marque est plus présente en France.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Der 800 ist einfach das Highend Topmodell von Rotring!
review: Ich hatte erst den 600 von Rotring, wollte aber unbedingt wissen wie der 800 ist! Kurze Antwort: "Der 800 ist das Highend Topmodell, die noch besser Haptik und die einfahrbare Spitze setzten dem ganzen einfach die Krone auf! Ganz klar weltweit bester Druckbleistift und das noch mit raffiniert einfahrbarer Schreibspitze!

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Not a made-in-Germany product
review: All over the marketing and ads you see they talk about Germany, until you open the box and find out, it’s made in Japan. So disappointing! I feel that’s cheating!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 April 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Disappointed
review: I bought this Rotring 800 mech pencil because it was on at a really good price. Unfortunately, the pencil is not working. The lead is not feeding through the pencil, the lead sleeve is blocked and the clearance pin will not go into the sleeve. Also, the lead sleeve etc. pushes back into the pencil body when the slightest pressure is applied to the tip. I will stick with my Rotring 600 and others.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 February 2024

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: The tip wobble really isn't that bad
review: No doubt if you are looking into a 45 quid pencil you'll be doing your research. And some of that will lead you to a lot of people saying that the retractable Rotring has a slight tip wobble (because it's moving parts). I've been using this daily for  over a year now and it's still going strong. I'm a massive fidgetter so I'm constantly popping the nib in and out and taking the rubber protector on and off and it's still not gotten to a point where it's worn or damaged. This is my favourite pencil. It weighs a really nice amount for me and feels like a good bit of kit.The improvements I think it could do with are minor. The first is the little tab thing that you slide it onto shirt pockets and what not. I think this should not be painted. This area is the one that gets the most wear and naturally the paint chips. It'd made more sense to plain finish it. The second is the availability of the rubbers. The rubbers last ages but they are a little difficult to pickup, in the end I opted to go for the ones direct from their site because they are a special size and didn't want to get the wrong ones.Besides that though I really like the pencil. I'd definitely recommend it if you are looking to upgrade to a something proper.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 March 2019

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Bad customer experince
review: I received a defective pencil. The mechanism was sticky and would not retract. I returned almost a month ago, but I am still waiting for the refund to be processed.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 January 2024

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: A Beautiful Pencil
review: This is the best mechanical pencil I have ever bought.There are a few reviews on here about the tip wobbles, well, I have to tell you there is no wobble on mine.The weight and balance is spot on and very comfortable in the hand.The retractable nib is a nice touch. I love it.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 May 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Portamine quasi perfetto,ma peezzo elevato.
review: Mi piace molto la linea e la sensazione di alta qualita'che da in mano.Il prezzo un tantino elevato anche se la qualita' si paga

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: 800 vs 600
review: 800 is heaver than 600.The pencil's head that moves in and out of the body is jiggly when writing. (on certain angles it is not)The push button on 800 is hard and also jiggly due to having a little extra room for lead sleeve parts.I like the 600's material better.The lead sleeve of 600 always is out and sharp and fragile.So, if you do not drop your pencil a lot (and break the sleeve lead of 600) and if you have a pencil casethen 600 is good.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 April 2019

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: rOtring 800 Mechanical Pencil HB 0.7 mm, Black
review: i have purchased quite a few mechanical pencils in the past,and this one seems to be the best so far,comfortable weight,easy lead feed operationand the beauty of retrieving the  point..a good quality product..
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 March 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Lovely to use but it broke
review: I was really looking forward to a lifetime of use from this pencil but it broke after about a year.  The thread of the front piece became damaged and would !SLIP! Every time pressure was applied.  I would tighten it then !SLIP!.Sorry for the dramatics but I was really sad it broke.It was a lovely weight metallic angular feel, the propelling mechanism is smooth and tight and it was otherwise a joy to own.It was way too expensive to simply break in normal use.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2019

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Pencil has serious quality issues
review: I love Rotring pencils.  In general they are essentially the best drafting pencils around, both the Rotring Rapid Pro and the Rotring 600 are simply superb.  Having said all this it pains me to have to leave a negative review on the Rotring 800, but what can I say?  It is simply a bad product that is ridiculously overpriced.  Rotring touts the 800 as their cream of the crop mechanical pencil and it has a nifty twist mechanism, which pops in and out and makes the pencil pocket friendly by removing the sharp point.  And yes this twist mechanism does work; however, when you try to write with the pencil you will notice a lot of play in the metal tip.  Folks a mechanical drafting pencil is suppose to be precise.  Having a loose tip defeats the whole purpose of precise writing.  The pencil does look quite attractive, however; that is why it gets two stars.  Otherwise it is complete garbage.  If you want a high quality drafting pencil then buy either the Rotring Rapid Pro or the Rotring 600.  If you want a pocket safe pencil then get the Rapid Pro.  If you are not worried about the sharp point then buy the legendary Rotring 600.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 May 2015

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Quite disappointed £40 for a good quality pencil and just opened and come discolored not happy
review: Quite disappointed £40 for a good quality pencil and just opened and come discolored not happy
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 May 2022

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Disappointing after the 600
review: Like many others, it chomps lead in 2cm pieces- constant frustrating breaking. The only way to lessen this is to use harder lead (which I don't like) and not retract the nib (which was the whole point in buying it)- but still it happens occasionally. The mechanism seems to pinch the lead too hard unlike the 600. The broken pieces are always the same length. I have a massive collection of them. I went back to the 600 and it felt like the leads were lasting forever. The 800 is poor effort for the huge price. (I cannot sing the praises of the 600 enough though- beautiful in every way- except to transport with fragile pointy nib; I wish they would just have a lid!)
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 May 2016

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: EXCELENTE
review: ARTICULO A BUEN PRECIO Y EXCELENTE ARTICULO Y MARCA.  GRACIAS.

prod_name: Faber-Castell Grip Plus Set 130997 Mechanical Pencil-Assorted Color
title: Un lujo de portaminas
review: Un capricho de portaminas. Realmente se aprecia la calidad de los materiales y lo bien que funcionan los mecanismos. Compré para bocetar el 0.7 y con minas 2B va fantástico. Muy recomendable.

review: Os lápis são muito bons. Gosto muito da Derwent. É a primeira vez que compro a linha Academy.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: ACADEMY
review: Cette catégorie est d'une très mauvaise qualité.  Derwent est une excellente marque de crayons et ses sets sont d'excellente qualité mais ... ce set "Academy" est la scrap de toute cette gamme.  Les mines sont soit cassées soit un coup qu'on les a aiguisées ces crayons ont diminués du tiers.  C'est le plus bas de gamme de Derwent.  Ils devraient la cancellée car elle fait ombre au nom de Derwent qui est d'une excellente qualité.  Je regrette mon achat mais si je ne les avais pas achetés je ne l'aurais pas su.  Mmême mes petits-enfants ne veulent plus les utilisés!  Mon opnion de la marque Derwent, par contre, n'a pas changée, j'adore cette marque.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: Perfect
review: Perfect for a beginners set everything you need for drawing. Great quality

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: good
review: I bought this for my 3 year old daughter.The lead is soft and the color on the paper is smooth. The pen is slightly thinner and easy to hold in small hands.However, the lead is so soft that it sometimes breaks when sharpening the pencil.But I am satisfied with it because it is inexpensive and comes in a variety of colors.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: MUCHO PIGMENTO

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: La massima qualità per gli amanti del disegno
review: Se cercate dei pastelli di qualità, che non siano i classici Faber Castell o Stabilo, allora vi consiglio di acquistare i modelli della Derwent. Non conoscevo inizialmente questo marchio, però informandomi e provandole personalmente mi sono accorto di quanto siano di qualità. Non solo vengono consigliati a chi studia nelle accademie di belle arti, ma hanno una qualità costruttiva eccezionale. La linea Academy permette di creare sfumature di vario genere, senza rovinare troppo il foglio. Il tratto non è troppo pesante e non necessita di grande pressione per poterci disegnare. La matita in se è di ottima qualità. Non appena riceverete la confezione a casa, vi troverete davanti ad una scatola di metallo molto comoda e resistente, con all'interno un set di colori da 24, ideali per dei disegni con non troppe sfumature. Se volete semplicemente disegnare su carta, vi consiglio di acquistare queste per il prezzo più basso, altrimenti puntate su altre linee sempre della Derwent.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: Mon fils les adore
review: Mon fils ne veut plus d'autres sortes de crayons pour l'école, ni pour ailleurs, depuis qu'il a essayé ceux-ci. Ils sont vraiment très bien et la livraison a été très rapide alors je les recommande fortement.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: Lápices correctos
review: De una calidad media, adecuados para un uso infantil/escolar o, al menos, no demasiado exigente en cuanto a la intensidad de los colores. Obviamente, se nota en el precio la calidad de los pigmentos pero eso es común a cualquier otro material, ya sea grafito, óleo, acuarela...Si se necesita una alta calidad, mejor optar por los Polychromos de Faber Castell o similares. Pero hay que tener en cuenta que la alta calidad suele venir acompañada de alto precio.En resumen, calidad media a un precio razonable.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Colouring Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin Box, Blendable Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2301938
title: Dodgy batch - beware!
review: **I contacted Derwent and explained the issues outline below. They replaced the specific colours I was having issues with and, though not professional quality (obviously), I have a set of consistent pencils that are actually useful and worth the money. Thank you Derwent for the excellent customer service!**Having used and enjoyed Derwent grahite pencils for some time, I had enough confidence in the brand buy this set of coloured pencils. OK, I knew they were the 'academy' ones, and that they wouldn't be as good as the more professional choice.However, the quality of some of the pencils renders the set virtually useless for more than just basic 'colouring in'.Firstly, the colours of some pencils are questionable - the 'deep red' is not significantly different from the 'red', the 'light blue' is a good deal darker than the 'blue' the 'lime green' and 'acid yellow' are pretty similar and the black is nothing more than a dark gray.Secondly is how the pencils lay down pigment. With some of the pencils they hardly lay down any colour at all. with the purple pencil you feel like you're tearing through the paper just to get some colour on the page. same with 'rose'and blue.Finally, they don't blend all that well. Some colours do, but a lot simply do not. Same thing with burnishing.Having used more expensive pencils in the past, I'd recommend that you don't cut corners, and just go straight to professional grade pencils. You'll have a lot more fun, create more vibrant art, and be a whole lot less frustrated in the process.This purchase feels a lot like £15 wasted.

Però son lun po' troppo duri e questo fa sì che alla primacaduta la mina interna del colore possa rompersi facilmente, facendo si che alla tempera del colore, la punta di spezzi facilmente. Il mio giudizio e' comunque buono, ma per esperti che siano molto attenti a non fare cadere i colori. Ottimo prezzo, spedizione veloce.

title: Excellent rapport qualité prix
review: C'est vrai que l'emballage n'est pas top mais on achète rarement des crayons pour leur paquet. Ils sont excellent, sans doute les meilleurs en terme rapport qualité prix. Je préparai mes couleurs hier pour un dessin de fleurs et je selectionnais les bonnes couleurs entre mes Polychromos, Luminance, Chromaflow et Goldfaber. J'ai rajouté ceux-ci dans le mix et franchement les couleurs sont bien intenses et très intéressantes. Ce sont des crayons à mine de cire comme les Chroma et les Luminance. prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Wish I had found these first
review: These might be a "middle" quality pencil but they are nice. (Note of thanks to those who do coloring books, you seem to be driving the price down and the quality up from the "student" grade.)They lay down smooth even colors that are as bright or as light as you want (pressure on the pencil).  The hexagonal shape makes them easier to use for longer times than the round pencils. The core does not break, at least I have not broken one yet.Compared to Prismacolor Primer, they are bolder colors, lay down smother, and actually blend much better.  (Possibly due to FC's use of veggie oil instead of wax?)So far I've only used them with the Prismacolors to get the detail and wet fresh paint look quicker. So for those who know color pencils, this does in one pass what the Prismacolors does in 4 or 5.  I've used them to get a color that I don't have in the Prisma set.  They also have some interesting colors not common in other sets (gold, silver, copper). I think I will use the Prisma's as an underpainting and then lay these down on top for that finished look.My only complaint is that there is a consistency problem.  Some colors, notably the lighter ones, do not perform the same way the darker colors do.  The light colors seem to be a much harder core.  That means more passes.Also 48 colors is fairly limited. (Not a complaint, just an observation for the serious artist.)For the money I'm very happy with these and wish I had found them first.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Excellent set!
review: I like these colours very much!  They blend beautifully and the assortment is very good.  I've never had a core break and they sharpen to a fine point in my Staedtler hand held sharpener.  The only thing I have a problem with is getting real depth with the black pencil.  Fortunately, it isn't a pencil I use often.  Probably when I am more used to coloured pencils, I'll figure it out.  I mostly paint in watercolour and acrylic and there is definitely another learning curve with coloured pencils.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Colour blending
review: The last colour pencil I had was twenty years ago, and it was a set of 48 colour pencils from other brand. This is a huge increase in terms of the choice of colours, which is a luxury, and at the same time, new experience. Please note, I have only tried those colours in blue. Here are my thoughts: (1) some of the colours blend in very well with each other, even up to four colours of blue blend in with each other as if it is natural.(2) not every colour blend, some stand up as it's own and can never be blended with others. I assume these are best for the "light" as shown in the pictures. It stands alone, so you don't need to worry these colours will get "intruded" by others.(3) there are some -to my surprise - has some shinny powder incorporated into the colour, the idea behind is really nice, as they are supposed to "reflect and shine" on the paper. However, pressure on these colours will actually reveal a dark-greyish colour instead of luxury reflective colour. Do note that I am still getting a hold on these colours, my impression on these new shine powder incorporated into colour pencils might change over time.Overall I am satisfied, and please note: never let the colour pencils fall from the table, the colour breaks instantly.Updates:Drew the last picture, and I am actually quite satisfied with the performance of the color pencil. Those few pencil with shiny powder incorporated can never be used to blend with other colors, but it has its own specialty and perhaps I might able to use them one day in some special things.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Decent pencils..
review: These are oil based so they have a harder core & hold a super sharp tip for detailed work. Only downside is they are a bit muted in color. The shade represented on the barrel is brighter than the actual color on the page. I do appreciate the 4 metallic colored pencils. Prompt shipping from seller.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams

review: High quality, deep rich colours, and nice variety included in the box. The price is a bit high for the quantity, but the quality is too good and compensated for the price. These are the only colour pencils I like to use.

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Un cadeau idéal pour les amateurs de dessin
review: J’ai acheté ce set de crayons de couleur pour mes loisirs créatifs. Les crayons sont de forme hexagonale, ce qui les rend confortables à tenir. Ils ont une mine résistante, ce qui évite les cassures et les gaspillages. Les couleurs sont variées et vives, elles couvrent bien le papier sans baver. Le set comprend également un double taille-crayon et deux gommes sans PVC, ce qui est pratique. Le seul bémol est que l’étui en carton n’est pas très solide, il se déchire facilement. J’aurais préféré un étui en métal ou en plastique pour mieux protéger les crayons. Sinon, je suis satisfait de ce produit qui correspond à mes attentes

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: Gut für Kinder und Jugendliche geeignet
review: 72er Set  im Karton mit Kartonaufsteller, 13,89€Die Stifte sind weich und cremig, sehr gut pigmentiert und sehr gut lackiert, haben Farbnummern und auf der Rückseite ein weißes Beschriftungsfeld für den Namen. Die Stiftenden sind gerade abgeschnitten und unlackiert.Die Minen zerbrechen kaum und lassen sich sehr gut anspitzen. Ein Übereinanderlegen von mehreren Farbschichten ist ebenfalls gut möglich. Radieren lassen sie sich gut mit einem weichen weißen oder transparenten Radierer.Von der Farbzusammenstellung her sind es kräftige Farben, die sich vor allem für den Schulunterricht eignen dürften. Gedeckte Farbtöne hingegen zum Zeichnen von naturalistischen Landschaften, Pflanzen, Tieren, Portraits etc. fehlen bis auf gedecktes Olivgrün. Ansonsten sind alle Farben klar, kräftig und leuchtend. Es gibt keine doppelten Farbtöne. Dazu kommen 5 Metallic-Stifte in Violett, Mittelblau, Blaugrün, Gold und Silber, die einen ganz dezenten Schimmer haben.Farbzusammenstellung: wenige Gelb- und Orangetöne, sehr viele Rot- und Pinktöne, eine gute Auswahl an Blautönen, eine auf den ersten Blick etwas unharmonische Auswahl an Grüntönen, eine gute Auswahl an Brauntönen und zwei Grautöne. Dazu Weiß und Schwarz. Das Weiß kann man zum Malen auf dunklem Papier verwenden, zum Setzen von Glanzlichtern auf anderen Farben eignet es sich nicht, da es nicht stark genug pigmentiert ist. Wenn man die Grüntone nach Farbnuancen (gelblich, bläulich, bräunlich) und nach Helligkeitsstufen ordnet, ergibt die Auswahl Sinn.Die Minen sind von der Härte her alle gleichermaßen weich bis auf ein helles Gelbgrün und Ocker. Diese beiden Stifte sind in meiner Packung schwächer pigmentiert und deutlich härter.Die leichte Kartonage ist wahrscheinlich nur zum Verkauf und Versand gedacht, nicht zur dauerhaften Aufbewahrung. Der Aufsteller aus dünnem Karton ist standhaft und geschmackvoll.Einzelstifte kann man nicht nachkaufen. Eine Farbkarte des Herstellers gibt es auch nicht.Merkwürdig ist, dass Faber-Castell in denselben roten Verpackungen, gleichgültig ob Kartonage oder Metallkasten, zwei verschiedene Qualitäten vermarktet: Neben der oben beschriebenen eher weichen Qualität auch noch eine weitere, die eher härtere Minen besitzt, keine Farbnummern und kein Namensfeld hat und auch etwas dünner lackiert ist. Wenn man eine Packung kauft, weiß man nicht, welche Qualität man bekommt.Fazit: sehr gute Stifte für Kinder und Jugendliche zu einem hervorragenden Preis, ansprechend aufzubewahren im  Karton-Aussteller. Die  Farbauswahl sollte vom Hersteller einmal etwas überarbeitet werden, dann können sie auch von Erwachsenen gut benutzt werden (weniger Rot- und Pinktöne, mehr Gelb- und Orangefarben, ein Creme-Farbton und ein stark pigmentiertes Weiß). Ein Nachkauf von Einzelstiften anhand der Farbnummern auf der Webseite des Herstellers wäre wünschenswert, ebenso eine ausdruckbare Farbkarte. Des Weiteren sollte sich der Hersteller einmal für EINE Qualität, vorzugsweise für die weichere, entscheiden.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 17 September 2023

prod_name: Faber-Castell 111260 Colour Pencils (Pack of 60),3.5 x 18.6 x 21 cm; 399.16 Grams
title: We like 'em!
review: I read a lot of reviews of various coloured pencils before buying these. I am very happy with them. I'm no expert, but they are not on the "waxy" side. I was looking for something less waxy, so these are good for my uses. They blend "ok." I used them on regular paper (adult colouring book style) as well as on a canvas, like for painting. Paper was very good. On the canvas they were really nice, and the only thing I'd say to be wary of is that they smudge very easily. I imagine waxy ones would smudge less. So I like the finished product, but just beware of smudging. I'm going to look for some kind of spray on plastic coating to protect my masterpiece ;-) from smudging. I will definitely go with Faber-Castell again, and now that I know what to expect I will invest in a bigger set to get more colour options.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 January 2019

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215

review: Super graphic Stifte.

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: Very good pencils, one frustrating flaw...
review: Great set of quality sketching pencils which do what they say on the tin. Four stars for a couple of reasons: they were not packaged brilliantly so subjected to some force during delivery. This may result in the soft leads being broken inside the pencils, time will tell. Secondly, and this may seem a bit picky, the wave pattern on the bottom of each pencil doesn’t line up when in the tin and the name is pointing upwards. For an artist this is really frustrating and looks messy! You can either have a wave pattern going across the bottom of the tin nicely or the pencil names showing but not both. It’s really annoying but if things like that don’t bother you, you can’t go wrong with the actual pencils.
