prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

prod_name: Derwent Graphic Soft Graphite Drawing Pencils, Ideal For Illustrating & Shading, Set Of 12, Professional Quality, 34215
title: 前買った時よりマシになっている。
review: 以前６本セット缶を購入したが、「芯がボキボキ折れてまともに削れない」（実質使用不可能）という恐るべき低劣品質だった。今回缶デザインがリニューアル、もしかして品質も改善されているかもと購入してみた。ら、今のところ削っても折れない（！！）缶自体、かつての６本缶のペラい質感のものよりしっかりしているし、缶のプリント塗装も上質な感じ。蓋の下、鉛筆の上からラッピングされており、固定されてガチャつかず輸送されてきたのも勝因か。ダーウェントはヨーロッパメーカー（カランダッシュ除く）的に乾いた手応え、ステッドラーより肌理は粗め。が、粗過ぎない適度な肌理。今回H硬度も試したくミディアムを選んだが、かなり粗めでひっかかりのあるH硬度。発色は薄いが肌理が粗いのでソフトに感じる。B硬度は「こんなにネットリしてたっけ？」、全体に「こんなに粗かったっけ？」な印象。ガリガリした粒子もH硬度からB硬度全てにもれなく頻繁に出るので、肌理細かい効果を求める人には全くお勧めしない。概して缶蓋の作品にあるような木炭デッサンみたいなちょっとソリッドなタッチになる（向いている）。特筆すべき注意点は、表面が滑らかな傾向にある日本的な紙には向かない（粗いくせにツルツル滑って乗りにくい）。以前買った時より鉛筆の塗装は良くなっている（２分割した木の継ぎ目が目立たないし塗装も厚めになってムラも無い）。が、木の接着がスムースではなく、電動では問題無いが小型削り器ではガタガタと無理な力がかかってささくれがち、その振動で芯が折れやすい（やはり芯はもろい）。HBでも尖らせた芯先が砕けて折れやすい。定着もズバ抜けて悪く摩擦で紙面が汚れがち。以上、品質的にはドイツ・日本・スイス製より圧倒的に劣るが、肌理のある、鉛筆向きの紙にサリサリとドライな手応えで描きたい自分的には納得づくでの買い物。ただし、缶は蝶番が無い、蓋が分離するタイプ。さらに携帯すると中が偏ってバラバラになり不便。こういった缶の仕様だし、芯もあいかわらず強くはないので衝撃には注意したほうがいい。（使用始めで主に硬い硬度中心に使っているので、B硬度に使用に耐える強度があるのかは疑心暗鬼。使い物にならないようなら追記します）★ ちなみに下位ラインの『アカデミー』シリーズは違う（恐らく中国製）が、こちらは英国製。

title: Great quality, great condition
review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

Heureusement que je n'ai pas craqué sur le pack de 36, dont je trouve le prix indécent pour la qualité.Ne vous faites pas avoir, achetez une autre gamme ou une autre marque.

title: Resistentes y cómodos
review: Estuche con 12 lápices de colores lo suficientemente variados entre sí. Tienen una buena calidad de construcción y un buen acabado. La forma triangular les confiere más comodidad que los redondos o hexagonales tradicionales, además de evitar de que se vayan rodando.Los colores están muy bien y las puntas son bastante resistentes. Al precio al que están no se puede pedir más, pues hay alternativas más caras que son peores.

review: Buntstifte sind nicht gleich Buntstifte. Ich habe einmal billig gekauft und es bereut. Diese malen viel schöner, vor allem für kleine Kinderhände, die noch nicht so stark aufdrücken können. Unsere 2-jährige kommt gut damit zurecht.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Weich und robust!
review: Ganz tolle Buntstifte!- Sie scheinen sehr bruchresistent zu sein und sind noch nicht brüchig, obwohl sie bei uns ständig runter fallen!- Die Spitze ist weich und man erzielt auch mit wenig Druck einen satten Farbauftrag.- Durch die dreikantige Form liegen sie gut in der Hand und sind auch bestens für die Grundschule geeignet. Hier würde ich mir aber etwas griffigeres wünschen, denn die Stiftoberfläche ist sehr glatt.- Habe ich schon die schöne Farbauswahl erwähnt?- Die Stifte selbst sind nicht aus Holz, sondern aus dem für BIC typischen weichen, etwas gummigen(?) und leicht biegsamen Kunststoffmaterial (was genau das ist, weiß ich leider nicht).Haben schon 2 Packungen durch und werden sie bestimmt wieder kaufen. 👍

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Pintan muy bien y no se rompen
review: Le compré para el cole a mi hija estos lápices de colores y me han gustado mucho.Vienen  con una buena presentación, muy bonita, colorida y que protege a los lápices adecuadamente.Vienen un total de 12 lápices de colores, todos ellos muy diferentes y que dan bastante juego. Es us set básico pero muy bien proporcionado.La calidad de los lápices es buena. No se rompen y pintan muy bien.Hay que tener en cuenta que no es el típico diseño hexagonal, sino que es como una especie de triángulo con cantos redondeados. Se pinta cómodamente, pero requiere un rato de adaptación.La relación calidad-precio me parece estupenda.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Grundsortiment an Farben
review: Im Lieferumfang befinden sich 12 Buntstifte, bei denen die Außenfarbe jeweils der Minenfarbe entspricht. Hinzu kommt noch, dass goldfarbene Wellenlinien und das Logo von BIC auf dem Stift aufgedruckt ist. Hier weiß ich nicht zu sagen, ob es sich um ein rein optisches Element handelt oder ob diese Linien für mehr Grip sorgen sollen. Verpackt sind diese Buntstifte in einer farblich ansprechenden Papier Umverpackung, die allerdings nur mit einem Klebestreifen wieder zu verschließen ist.Die Farbauswahl spricht mich an, da es die Grundfarben abdeckt. Durch ihre 3 eckige Form liegen die Farbstifte gut in der Hand und sie malen wirklich gut. Bei großflächigem Farbauftrag sind die Farben deckend und auch feine Linien können gut ausgeführt werden. Dazu sind die Farbaufträge sehr kräftig und leuchten intensiv. Die Minen sind schön weich, aber trotzdem brechen sie nicht schnell ab oder werden zerdrückt. Wenn mal die Buntstifte mal anspitzen möchte, ist dies mit einem normalen Anspitzer möglich. Allerdings sollte man drauf achten, dass dieser auch scharf ist, da sonst die Spitzen mehr gedrückt als geschnitten werde.Trotz dieser tollen Stifte habe ich aber trotzdem einen Kritikpunkt. Da man diese Stifte ja mehrmals nutzen möchte und sie auch in einem höheren Preissegment sich befinden, hätte ich eine Verpackung erwartet, die nicht gleich bei der ersten Entnahme reißt. Zudem wäre es schön, wenn man die Stifte gleich auf einem Blick sehen könnte und nicht erst eine Reihe nach der anderen aus der Verpackung nehmen müsste.  Zwar gibt es in der Mitte der Verpackung eine Aussparung, in der man ein paar Stifte sehen kann, aber leider nicht das ganze Spektrum.Zusammenfassend kann ich sagen, dass mich diese Buntstifte überzeugt haben, da sie eine gute Qualität haben und auch sehr vielseitig anzuwenden sind. Lediglich bei der Verpackung müsste etwas geändert werden.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Colores para el cole
review: Soy maestra y tengo niñas de tres años que están descubriendo las pinturas y los colores. El producto es una caja de 12 colores de madera. La caja esta muy bien presentada con la imagen de las diferentes tonalidades que podemos encontrar dentro del paquete.Si nos centramos en la calidad de los colores, tengo que decir que son buenos. La marca conocida Bic, no defrauda en la calidad de sus materiales. La forma triangular de los colores proporciona un buen agarre y permite que no se resbalen. Tiene una buena mina para colorear, con 3,2mm de grosor que permite un buen trazo. Los niños van a poder colorear sin problemas.Tengo que decir que estoy muy satisfecha con el producto. Me permite colorear y el color sale muy bonito. La calidad del color es buena y el precio es asequible para mi uso.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Buntstifte
review: Habe sie mir für ein Ausmalbuch gekauft.  Dafür sind sie nicht gut geeignet.  Aber sonst gute Stifte.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Robuste Stifte in schönen Farben
review: Die 12 Buntstifte wurden in einer Pappschachtel geliefert und bereits alle gespritzt, so dass man direkt mit dem Malen loslegen kann. Jeder Stift zeigt mit seiner Ummantelung die Stiftfarbe an, was es gerade für Kinder einfacher macht, den passenden Stift schnell zur Hand zu haben.Die dreieckigen Stifte liegen erstaunlich gut in der Hand, so dass sich damit wirklich schön und leicht malen lässt. Mit wenig Druck erreicht man helle, aber dennoch sehr gut sichtbare Farbergebnisse. Bei mehr Druck auf den Stift biegt sich dieser ein wenig, bricht jedoch nicht. Die Farbergebnisse werden dadurch deutlich intensiver.Dadurch, dass die Stifte kein Holz enthalten, sondern aus Kunstharz gefertigt sind, gibt es auch keine Splitter oder ähnliches. Die Stifte lassen sich super spitzen und bisher bleiben auch die Minen selbst beim Fallen vom Tisch etc. super intakt. Bei uns sind Groß und Klein von den Stiften begeistert.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Buenos, bonitos y baratos. ¡Reistentes!
review: Genial este pack de lápices de colores 'BIC Color Up Lápices de Colores Surtidos, Blíster de 12 Unidades' sobretod si se compra con la oferta actual de 2'90 euros. Vienen en un estuche de cartón con solapa para poderlo cerrar de nuevo una vez abierto.Los lápices son algo más gruesos que los habituales, meorando el agarre en niños de cierta edad. Además tienen una forma triangular que ayuda a sujetarlo muy bien entre los dedos.Las minas son resistentes y no se rompen fácilmente aún apretando con ganas. Los colores son vivos y tapan muy bien.Realmente un buen pack para el cole o para casa a un precio formidable. Los recomiendo.

prod_name: BIC Intensity colored pencils, triangular crayons, colored pencils for painting in 24 colors, in cardboard case, shatterproof lead & without wood (package may vary)
title: Kräftige Farben, bruchsichere Minen
review: Dieses Buntstifteset von BIC beinhaltet 12 Stifte in einem Kartonetui. Nachdem ich meine Tochter jede Woche mehrmals mit auf die Arbeit nehmen muss (Corona sei dank), haben wir diese Stifte kurzerhand mitgenommen und dort deponiert. Dadurch sparen wir uns ein Teil weniger, das wir zum Bespaßen mitnehmen müssen.Insgesamt gibt es 12 verschiedene Farben, die typischen Standardfarben. Einige kleinere Gemälde sind nun schon entstanden und was die Farbintensität angeht, sind wir zufrieden.Die Stifte haben eine Dreikantform. Für die Grundschule (zumindest die ersten Klassen) werden Dreikantbuntstifte empfohlen, um die richtige Griffhaltung zu lernen und zu verinnerlichen. Aus diesem Grund eignen sich die Stifte auch hierfür.Bisher ist keine Mine abgebrochen, obwohl manche Stifte schon den Boden geküsst haben. Sie lassen sich gut spitzen und vermalen.Alles in allem gibt es hier ein gutes Buntstiftset zu einem fairen Preis. Für Kinder absolut ausreichend.

title: water soluble but last a long time!
review: i bought these on an artists recommendations... i just  got them  but  tried them right away , so much  fun for  marking and adding  a pop of colour  if you like mixed media,, they blend in...  my grandson, 2... can hold them and loves them a lot..... also so big  they dont get lost!  the enclosed sharpener is handy as they are  full of colour

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Crayons "inusables" et solides qui fonctionnent sur ardoise Veleda !
review: Ces crayons Woody nous ont été conseillés par la maîtresse de notre petite dernière en CE1, car ils sont effectivement utilisables sur les ardoises Veleda et contrairement aux feutres, ils ne s'usent pas (en tout cas beaucoup moins vite) ! Les ardoises Veleda sont utilisées quotidiennement ici et c'est vrai que les feutres qui vont avec ont une fâcheuse tendance à ... défiler ! Du coup on a testé. Ces craies grasses tiennent très bien sur l'ardoise, sans forcer les couleurs sont nettes, vives. Après un petit coup d'éponge humide, c'est effacé. Comme ils ont une mine ça va très bien pour écrire. Ils sont bien assez gros pour ne pas se casser (on a eu peur que des chutes leurs soient fatales comme avec des crayons de couleur mais il est mentionné "incassable" sur la pochette, vu l'épaisseur et la texture, c'est bien possible). Et en plus un taille crayon est fourni quand la mine s'use (ça heureusement parce que vu la taille des crayons, le format est très particulier ;)).Le prix est un peu élevé mais je suis contente de les avoir eu en promo (13€ environ pour 10) et quand on fait le calcul avec leur durée de vie potentielle, tout est relatif...En photo, un dessin sur ardoise ... oui étant donné toutes les jolies couleurs ma fille n'a pu s'empêcher de dessiner au lieu d'écrire :)

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: great pigment and versatility
review: They're very thick and are still very thick after sharpening but versatile with great colour and work on many surfaces.  Would love to be able to obtain a sharper point with the sharpener.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Super stifte zum malen auch am Fenster
review: Wir haben die Stifte gekauft für das Fenster. Es klappt super und ist mit Wasser wieder abwaschbar. Den Kindern macht es sehr viel Spaß.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Ottimo acquisto. Soddisfatissima!!!!
review: Bellissimi matitoni dai colori brillanti, morbidi e maneggevoli a sufficienza per essere utilizzati anche dai più piccoli (mia figlia ha 20 mesi) ma resistenti alle cadute. Scrivono ovunque, legno, plastica e vetro compresi e vengono via con un semplice panno umido di acqua, soprattutto dalle mani, a differenza dei tanto decantati pennarelli ad acqua che invece stentano parecchio. Insomma, nonostante il prezzo esorbitante per una scatola di pastelloni, l'acquisto vale la pena.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Great pencils
review: Great pencils for multi media. While terrific for children my mom 98 years young loved them and even with arthritis was able to grip them. They are on the expensive side

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Toller Inhalt, aber sehr ramponierte Verpackung :(
review: Wir haben die Stifte selbst schon für unsere Kleine gekauft und trotz dass sie vorher absolut nichts mit Malen anfangen konnte, liebt sie diese Stifte. Sie gleiten sehr leicht übers Papier, im Gegensatz zu anderen Buntstiften, sodass man tolle Erfolge erzielt. Die Wasserlöslichkeit ist bei kleinen Kindern natürlich ein unschlagbarer Vorteil und man kann völlig entspannt bleiben, wenn mal was auf den Tisch daneben geht. 😉Was ich allerdings super ärgerlich finde: bei der jetzigen Nachbestellung war die Verpackung ziemlich ramponiert und wir dachten direkt, die Stifte wurden schon benutzt (waren aber unbenutzt). Normal würde mich das nicht stören, aber diese Packung war als Geburtstagsgeschenk gedacht und macht so absolut keinen tollen Eindruck (habe zwei Beispielbilder angefügt). Wir werden sie (aus Umweltgründen) dennoch behalten, aber ärgern tuts mich trotzdem, etwas zu verschenken, das aussieht, als hätten wir es aussortiert... 🙁 Würde ich unter den Umständen dann vielleicht doch eher im Laden kaufen beim nächsten Mal.

title: Great for artists of all ages
review: These are great tools for artists of all ages, with a pleasant hand feel. Very versatile at mark making, can be used dry or like watercolour pastels and blend with water. Great for making bold and impactful art.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 September 2023

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Unsere Kinder lieben den Stift, am meisten Spass macht es ihnen die Scheiben zu bezahlen
review: Die STABILO woody 3 in 1 Buntstifte, Wasserfarben und Wachsmalkreiden im 10er Pack mit Spitzer überzeugen durch ihre vielseitige Anwendbarkeit und lebendige Farbauswahl. Die Stifte liegen angenehm in der Hand und ermöglichen präzises Malen sowie kreative Farbmischungen. Die wasserlöslichen Eigenschaften eröffnen neue Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten, während die Wachsmalkreiden für intensive Farbergebnisse sorgen. Der mitgelieferte Spitzer rundet das Gesamtpaket ab, und die zehn verschiedenen Farben bieten eine breite Palette für künstlerische Entfaltung. Die hochwertige Qualität und die Langlebigkeit machen die STABILO woody 3 in 1 zu einer erstklassigen Wahl für kreative Köpfe jeden Alters.

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener

title: mérite 5 étoiles
review: très beaux crayons de couleurs. taille idéal pour les enfants en bas âge ! très robustes ils peuvent appuyés ils ne s'écrasent pas . vous pouvez même coloré une feuille en noir et repasser dessus avec une autre couleur et sa fonctionne hyper bien. ne tache pas , et si vous ajouter de l'eau avec un pinceau cela se transforme en peinture. Idéal aussi pour les tableaux sur pieds coté tableau blanc mieux que des feutres je recommande +++  fourni avec un gros taille crayons qui va parfaitement !! couleurs intenses sans forcer . cliquer sur mon commentaire si vous avez trouvé cela utile :)

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Robust, unterschiedliche Funktionen,super für Kinder
review: Man kann mit diesen stiften auf Glas malen (zb Fenster), man kann jedoch auch ganz normal auf Papier malen. Die 3. Funktion ist  mit Wasser möglich. Die Farben müssen etwas dicker auf dem Blatt sein und dann kann mit Wasser dann ein Aquarellartiges Bild entstehen.Die Stifte sind super für Kinderhände geeignet, da mein Sohn (2) oft Sachen durch die gegend wirft, brechen die meisten Mienen. Das ist hier absolut nicht der Fall. Jetzt nach 1monat testen kann ich sagen, alle Stifte sind noch Heile :)Dadurch, dass hier ein Anspitzer bei war, lassen sich die Stifte prima wieder in die Ursprungsform bringen und die Kinder können wieder weiter malen.Hier jedoch das , warum ich einen Stern abgezogen habe: Vorsicht bei dem roten Stift an der FensterfrontDas Gummi am Fenster ist beim abwischen etwas rosa geworden und ich habe es noch nicht wegbekommen. Falls jemand eine Idee hat, mit welchem Mittel das möglich ist, gerne eine Info geben ;)

prod_name: Multi-Talented Pencil - STABILO woody 3 in 1 - Pack of 10 - Assorted Colours with Sharpener
title: Tolle Stifte!
review: Die Stifte sind schön handlich, so dass sie auch 1-jährige bereits benutzen können. Sie malen sehr gut. Mein Sohn hat großen Spaß mit ihnen. Sehr praktisch ist, dass sie auf Fensterglas malen und sich auch einfach entfernen lassen. Genausogut klappt das auf unserer Folie am Esstisch. Mini malt und wir haben noch ein paar Minuten länger zum Essen.Leider sind sie preislich sehr teuer. Wir ziehen sie dennoch günstigeren Alternativen vor.

review: In der Schule sind diese Stifte erwünscht, da die Farben so schön Leuchten und zu anderen Wachsmalstiften einfach viel stabiler und einfach anzusetzen sind, wie gesagt die Qual der Faben ist auch genial!Nachteil....Der Anspitzer ist extrem groß und dick und bisher hab ich noch nicht gesehen das man den separat kaufen kann, wobei in der 1 und 2 Klasse gern mal Dinge verschwinden.Auch ist die Packung nicht gerade toll, Kinderhände in der Grundschule ziehen gern mal kräftiger oder stopfen die Stifte rein und schwups ist die Packung gerissen.Ansonsten total super!

title: Produit haut de gamme très agréable
review: J'ai acheté ces crayons sur recommandation de la maîtresse de maternelle de ma fille et je ne regrette pas.La taille est très adaptée aux petites mains, le tracé sur papier est fluide avec de très beau rendu de couleur mais là où ils sont le plus intéressant c'est à l'utilisation sur support "lisses" sur la photo j'ai utilisé une pochette transparente mais cela fonctionne aussi sur les vitres ou sur une petite table d'enfant "laquée" ou recouverte d'un film "protège livre" par exemple.Les possibilités sont infinies et un coup de lingette humide tout s'efface et on peut recommencer.On peut donc presque tout imaginer...Le critère prix reste assez limitant pour les paquets avec nombreuses couleurs mais avec le lot de 10 couleurs permets déjà pleins de possibilité et c'est un énorme point positif car il est livré avec un taille crayon adapté.bref, je recommande. Si vous trouvez mon commentaire utile, n'hésitez pas à cliquer sur le bouton ci-dessous 😉

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Good for starters
review: I'm really glad I made the investment for real artist pencils, having the different varieties of darkness has helped me a lot in the last couple months since I got them.  I don't do that full greyscale shading stuff, barely breaking ground into general shading, no way I can do that.  But it makes it a lot easier for my drawings because instead of how I did it before where I would just try to draw the basic shapes and general outline with pencil, usually mechanical, lightly and then as I went, each new "layer" would be slightly darker with the permanent stuff that I would trace over with pen as the darkest, but then when I inked the drawing, let the ink dry, and go back to erase before coloring, it was often very difficult to get rid of all the pencil lines because of how hard and dark I had to go with some of them.  But now with these artist pencils, I lightly do the basic shapes with the lightest pencil, and as I go up in "layers" I go one or two pencils up for a darker line with minimal effort amd barely any pressure.  The result is a group of line in varying degrees of darkness that can still be easily erased once I have inked the final outline and I don't have pesky persistent lines and pressure spots showing through my color.  PLUS because you are using multiple pencils per drawing, they last a lot longer before needing to be sharpened.  The one I used most, the 5H, lasted almost two full months before needing to be sharpened and I still haven't sharpened any of the others.  My only beef is a cpuple of them have one spot on the led where it's kind of scratchy and instead of gliding over the paper I can feel it catching.  These are a good set for a starter or someone who doesn't intend to do full greyscale art like me, I doubt I will ever need to move up to a larger or higher end set than this one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Not enough tone difference between the H's and the B's
review: I had high hopes for this set of pencils, because it contained several pencils that I havent had in previous pencil sets - i think the darkest I've had was a 2B or 4B? And these went up to 6B - and I like how the B pencils get much softer and darker the farther down their scale you go. Unfortunately, though, there wasnt an extremely noticeable difference from the 6H all the way through to the 6B in this particular set of pencils. I need the softer darker pencils to be very blendable, and these just weren't. I made a chart where I colored a square using each pencil, in order, using the same amount of pressure in each one. There really wasnt a big difference. Then I tried to shade over the squares to see if the blended or smudged well, and you could still see all of the pencil hashmarks. On EVERY SINGLE ONE. I dont expect the H's to blend barely at all, but the hashmarks on all of the B's should have at least started to smudge. The way I draw consists mainly of shading and tone differences, ranging from really light to really dark pitch black.  I mostly use a stump to blend all of it together, and take turns alternating between my stump and my kneaded eraser to do the actual drawing, to bring out the highlights and deepen the shadows. These pencils just dont vary enough in the hardness for me. I'm going to keep them, though, because I just dont feel like going through the trouble to send them back just to get my five bucks back. I can always write letters with them, right?
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 February 2020

prod_name: Royal & Langnickel sketching artist pencils - set of 12 drawing pencils 5H to 6B
title: Great value pencils but the plastic sleeve is really annoying
review: I'm definitely no artist and I haven't even done any sketching in well over ten years but I was keen to jump back in. I remember I used to like 2B pencils, but I thought I'd grab a mixed pack and try to gauge how they all lay down. The quality seems great for the cost, they're pre-sharpened. The shaft seems to be natural wood so there's some variations in colour of the wood, which adds a little interest more than anything else. The graphite is transfers nicely and isn't too brittle. I quite liked the 2H the 2b and 5b in particular.The only downside is that I find the plastic packaging sleeve bloody awful. It's too fiddly to keep the pencils in to keep them in good condition as the short top flap is very sharp and stiff and tries to dig into the leads as you slide the pencils back in. Can't even seem to get the plastic to accept a fold back in the other direction to get it to stay open.

I guess you could get the little ones you stick on top, but maybe just buy a drawing pencil with an eraser built in.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: 素性の良いスタンダードの製品
review: ダーウェントはイギリスの画材屋さんで、各種製品をリリースされていて、以前から、インクテンスとペンをいくつか持っていました。基本的にダーウェント製品は小洒落てて、あと使用においてプロっぽい雰囲気があり楽しいです。こちらの、ダーウェントアカデミーの方の水彩色鉛筆と比べると、インクテンスの方が少しやわらかく、それでいて独特のインクのような発色をして、値段も高く、ちょっとキャラの立っているというのがインクテンスになります。こちらのダーウェントアカデミーの方は、もう少しシンプルでオーソドックスな印象です。普通に使ってるとしっかり固めの色鉛筆感があり、また、水彩時はインクテンスほど派手では無いのですが、少し明るめの発色をします。紙の方に先に水を塗っておいてから書くと、今度は逆に結構伸びます。ちょっと水彩時の発色が変わっていますが、良くも悪くも教科書通りの素性の良さがあります。お値段的にもリーズナブルで、教育学習用とかとしても良さそうです。これで、不満が出てきたら、上位モデルではより特徴がはっきりするので、インクテンスであるとか、他社製品の上位モデルに変えてみるとか、いろいろ楽しい入り口だと思います。

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: 水でぼかし・伸ばしが便利
review: どの色もきれいで、クレパスなどと違った描き方ができる。鉛筆に水を付けてぼかしたり、指で撫でて幅広く伸ばしたり、普通の色鉛筆と違った使い方ができて面白い。ハガキやちょっとした色付けしたいスケッチに便利。携帯するにもケースがしっかりして、使わないときは掛けられるようになっているのが、仕舞い忘れがなくてよいと思う。

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Good for beginners
review: The colours are perfect for beginners who want to experiment and get to know the basics on the style they want to go with. The colours get dissolved easily when water is applied and they are pretty easy to use.Only complain is that the colours are not bright/heavily pigmented as I expected them to be.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Muy buena calidad
review: Vienen perfectamente presentados, en caja metálica, y los colores son de una excelente calidad, suaves y con mucho pigmento. Se pueden usar perfectamente como colores normales o como acuarela humedeciendo la punta o pasando un pincel mojado sobre lo pintado. Nunca había utilizado este tipo de colores, así que aún tengo que acostumbrarme a ellos, pero la calidad me parece excelente.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: great pigment
review: I recently started bible journaling and these watercolor pencils are great. The colors are very vivid and blend nicely. Derwent comes highly recommended from the bible journaling community and I'm glad that I purchased these. My only regret is that I didn't buy the 72 count. I will be saving for the 72 count.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: 楽しい水彩色鉛筆
review: 以前、ステッドラー（エルゴソフト）を使っていたので、感じはそれとほぼ同じ（のはず）。カラトだと、滑らかにサラサラ描けるイメージ。こちらは、少し芯が硬いかな。２４色あるとグラデーションするにも便利ですし、あえて水彩にしなくても、それなりに楽しめます。（もちろん、絵具としても楽しめます）会社の引き出しにあると、電話のメモ書きも、ちょっとした気分転換になりますよ。

review: Thought I'd try these watercolor pencils in my new found hobby, adult coloring...They work well wet or dry.  I would recommend them anyone

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Great set of pencils for the price
review: I have been using these pencils extensively for the last few days and these are my observations:1. The colours are not as vivid as they are claimed to be. However when mixed with water, they are.2. Shades of red and blue are much stronger than greens and yellows.3. While blending one colour with another, it needs a very light hand.4. Blending is quite impossible when using dry pencil on wet paper.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2023

title: Good quality
review: I ordered these thinking they would 100% match the academy tube paints. There are a few that don't so I gave 4 instead of 5 rating. Otherwise I'm happy with the purchase.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Works for Me
review: Nice product to use, first time using this brand for watercolour pencils and think I have a new favourite. Came mostly as advertised, got all the colours specified and come across as I would expect. If your'e into watercolour you know what colours and vibrancy to expect, if you're into pencil drawing certain tones might seem less bright than expected but absolutely fab for watercolour pencils. Only thing is superficial, the cover of the tin isn't the fish on the main photo for this item but the paper boats design in the description so not as attractive but doesn't effect the product.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Beautiful and vibrant pencils
review: I love these watercolour pencils. I am so happy with them. I will be using these for my doll art. The colours are beautiful.The only thing I was not happy with was how Amazon packaged these pencils for delivery.  They were in a bag, not a box. Amazon should be shipping these and all Art pencils in a protective box, so the leads don't end up breaking. I ordered plastic drain cleaners and they came wrapped in a protective box with bubble wrap  But then I order something like these pencils and there is no bubble wrap or anything.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: スタイリッシュな色鉛筆。
review: 久しぶりに色鉛筆を手に取りました。発色は、水性なので優しい感じですが、とても鮮やかで澄んだ色ばかりです。力加減で濃淡も表現しやすく、絵にいろんな表情を持たせることが出来ます。最近、塗り絵にハマる大人が多いとテレビで見ましたが、なるほど、これは良い気分転換で癒されますね。
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 May 2020

title: Bonne entrée en matière
review: Crayons assez gras. Bonne entrée en matière dans le monde des crayon de couleur sérieux. Peut être un chouilla pas assez pigmenté par rapport au gras. On sature assez vite le papier. Mais on colore déja pas mal sans avoir besoin de trop appuyer. Il va faloir que j'apprenne àmélanger les couleurs. Ca demande de la subtilité car le crayon est gras. Il ne faut donc pas trop appuyer sinon on sature et on ne peut plus mélanger.Je suis satisfaite de l'achat.

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: They arrived and brought joy with them
review: I ordered these while in the hospital with severe injuries and long rehab. They arrived and brought joy with them. I love how the colours compliment each other, I.e. the colours that are shades and hues simply are lighter or darker versions, which makes it easier to blend for colours you may not have. That being said the selection of colour families is quite good and there wasn’t a single pencil that I haven’t used! I love this set, and from what I’ve seen of other brands, Derwent is a top brand to me!

title: Poor quality
review: Ive already had Derwent wc for a while, l decided to order the 24 pack for more choice - the new colours some were duplicates to what l already have which would be okay if they were the same colours !but are completely different for instance the shades -cadmium yellow) one is yellow and is one orange!!Same with yellow ochre different shadesthe wood on some are split they also have  burnt stamped initials at the nib end - why?

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Penscils
review: So the actually company i recieved these from is a good company that i have ordered from many times . Derwent is an expensive art brand and i own a few of their pemscil crayon sets . They are not cheap so i wasnt impressed to find one of my penscils cracked up the barrel and dinged up! It looked like it had a ruff life  i did contact compamy and waiting a response so im confident we will resolve this issue however i highly doubt i will be buying any more derwent products because the quality is to shoddy for the price they want and i will def miss my inktense:(
date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 May 2016

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Not Quite Right
review: I have previously used Derwent waterrcolour pencils and as mine were used down to nubs that are now impossible to hold, let alone draw with, it was time for a new box. Off I toddle to trusty Amazon to buy myself some new Derwent Watrercolour pencils and what a lovely price...however...the price reflects the product.Firstly, I noticed that the wood barrels were of different batches so that there was no uniformity..ok, small niggle, but a niggle all the same.Secondly, I found that the colours were very, very weak when used as a crayon and weaker still in watercolour. I know my stuff when it comes to using watercolour pencils (I even checked the instructions as I was doubting myself!) but nope, not as good as the last set at allSo, yes, they do what they need to do, but not as good as the last set, they were just not quite right for me
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 August 2023

prod_name: Derwent Academy Watercolour Pencils, Set of 24 in Tin, Multicolour Artist’s Pencils, Ideal for Wet or Dry Colouring, Drawing & Illustration, Premium Hobbyist Quality, 2300226
title: Watercolour pencils, in some ways better than crayons, for artwork with strong colours.
review: Very good for artwork, producing stronger images than ordinary crayons. Colours are good, from experience with the Conte type from years ago, the drawings and the pencils last well. Just don't get the drawings wet, they after all are water colours. Probably a lightly sprayed coat of clear lacquer will provide some protection for any masterpieces produced.

title: Recomendo para uso técnico. Os grafites da pentel são mais macios.
review: Ótimo produto! Acredito que competem com os grafites da pentel e no quesito conforto perdem para os 2B, 3B e 4B na escrita. A staedtler poderia ampliar os tipos de grafites.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 2505HBBK2D Mars Micro Refill Leads for Mechanical Pencils - HB, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 2 x Tubes of 12 Leads)
title: Des mines de graphite HB de qualité pour une écriture précise.
review: Les mines graphite Staedtler Mars Micro Carbon 250 sont un excellent choix pour ceux qui recherchent une écriture précise et nette. Avec deux étuis de 12 mines, ce blister offre une grande quantité de recharges. La dureté HB est polyvalente et convient à différents styles d'écriture. La qualité de fabrication de ces mines est remarquable, offrant une expérience d'écriture fluide et sans bavures. Si vous recherchez des recharges fiables pour vos porte-mines, ces mines graphite sont un choix sûr.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 2505HBBK2D Mars Micro Refill Leads for Mechanical Pencils - HB, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 2 x Tubes of 12 Leads)
title: Mine top, la custodia non tanto
review: Il prodotto è arrivato in una confezione integra.Il prezzo è molto conveniente ( solitamente spendo €4 per una confezione da 12 mine).La qualità della mina HB staedtler è ottima.Unica nota è il meccanismo della custodia delle mine, il quale dovrebbe fare scendere una mina alla volta premendo il tasto grigio: questo funziona 2 volte su 4.Del resto ciò che mi ha spinto ad acquistare tale prodotto è stato il prezzo, molto conveniente.

title: Un classico che non tramonta mai!
review: Mi è piaciuto il fatto che queste mine non ti danno mai, ripeto mai, problemi quando le utilizzi.Le varie gradazioni hanno il grado di morbidezza che risponde esattamente alla sigla di identificazione.Hanno una scorrevolezza sulla carta eccellente e, se la tua matita portamine non ha difetti, la mina non si inceppa mai: questo vuol dire che il calibro è esattamente quello dichiarato.Tutto questo vuol dire che anche per fare delle seplici mine ci vuole una certa esperienza e Staedtler dimostra di avercela. Ciao!

title: Lo ricomprerei 100 volte
review: Sono veramente soddisfatta dell’acquisto. La confezione contiene veramente tantissime mine di ricambio e la qualità è veramente ottima: meglio della mina originale che avevo nella mia penna.Ha una resistenza veramente eccellente: non si rompe nemmeno gettandola nello zaino pieno e non crea piccoli granuli quando si inizia a scrivere. Io la sto usando per sottolineare un libro con carta lucida e mi permette di tracciare linee sottili, dallo spessore omogeneo e nette, senza incidere la carta. Ottima anche su carta normale, dove non sbava per niente: apprezzatissimo visto che sono mancina

prod_name: STAEDTLER 2505HBBK2D Mars Micro Refill Leads for Mechanical Pencils - HB, 0.5mm (Blistercard of 2 x Tubes of 12 Leads)
title: 4 stelle
review: Non le ho ancora sconfezionate in quanto prese per tempo. Se all'apertura ci saranno sorprese, è un articolo che già da tempo uso, ri-recensirò.Per quanto riguarda l'imballo: è arrivato nei tempi previsti, con imballo APPENA SUFFICIENTE - DA MIGLIORARE - Probabilmente sarebbe stato opportuno che il tutto fosse inserito in un scatolone dalle misure adeguate al contenuto, tanto che quest'ultimo non sbattesse ovunque all'interno del cartone. In definitiva gli incaricati all'imballaggio dovrebbero porre più attenzione nella scelta di dove e come proteggere lo spedito, specialmente quando scelgono uno scatolone enorme per inserire più articoli. Il cartone è arrivato in più punti ammaccato ed un po' lacerato probabilmente a causa del peso del contenuto che, durante il trasporto, si è spesso spostato all'interno dello stesso. Il tutto fortunatamente è arrivato integro.

title: Totally reccomand the product

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Amazing Quality lead, no need for anything else
review: I bought 2 packs of these leads to go with my new mechanical pencil as I needed some replacements.I was not disappointed with the quality and durability of this brand. Having never bought this type of thing before, and only using disposable pencils I was very pleased to find that this lead was just as tough and durable as the nano diamond lead that came with my pencil.They are also just as comfortable to write with, the lead is smooth to the touch of paper and flows brilliantly, an absolute pleasure.Not only that but you get so many (40 leads) at such an amazing price. The stylish blue container they come in is very tough and keeps the lead safe inside, and the mechanism in the twist cap to open is brilliant for controlling how many leads you wish to remove from the container at any one time.They arrived very quickly and in a well padded, thick envelope. Very pleased with this purchase and I would highly recommend this product, I'll certainly be buying more when I eventually run out.Pros:- Very durable- High quantity- Smooth flowing- Stylish and durable container (reminds me of an old ipod)- Amazingly cheap- Well packaged- Quick deliveryCons:- None so far, very pleased.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 April 2017

title: Smooth and dark writing
review: I'm a bit of a writing nut and whilst at work would collect fountain pens. Now I'm long retired I love using mechanical pencils. HB leads don't show up very well on paper but obviously break less often. I've been using 2B leads for some time, softer leads have a smoother writing feel and are darker. I thought I'd try the 3B and am very happy with the results.

prod_name: Pentel Ain Stein Mechanical Pencil Lead, 0.5mm HB, 40 Leads (C275-HB)
title: Grande QUALITE et arrivés SANS CASSE !
review: Ma plus grande apréhension sur cet achat n'était pas le produit en lui même, mais le transport. Je pensais recevoir des débris de mines dans un petit conteneur en plastique : il n'en est rien.Même si l'envoi était rudimentaire (une lettre bien scotchée), tout était en ordre !J'ai sorti toutes les mines pour vérifier leur état : le nombre de mine indiqué (40) est exact, et de plus aucune mine n'était cassée !Le système d'ouverture permet de transporter les mines dans leur étui sans qu'il risque de s'ouvrir (le haut pivote sur lui même)Et j'ai pu également remettre toutes les mines dans leur étui .. là aussi sans casse.Ainsi, sans même avoir des mois d'expériences avec ces mines, je peux déjà assurer que c'est de la qualité.Je conseille donc fortement, sans aucun soucis !(Si vous avez apprécié ce retour, votez "Commentaire utile" ! ça fait toujours plaisir)

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great coloring pencils
review: Arteza coloring pencils arrived early. Opened them immediately. They are every bit as good as others have said they are. They are presharpened and have very vibrant colors. Smooth, easy to use.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Very good pencils
review: There's so many reasons why I really enjoy these pencils. I didn't start truely loving them until i got Hanna Karlzons books. In my Johanna Basford they worked well, but in Hanna Karlzon books they shine. So like with any pencil, paper matter.When I thought I had filled the tooth of it completly, is till wanted to add more shading i could still add layers of new colors. I find them effortless in blending, everything I have tried in those books.I have also found that you can safely buy from arteza. If there is any kind of problem they will fix it.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A joy to draw and colour with them !
review: There is nothing to dislike about this pencils .  They layer beautiful , are soft core but can hold a fine point and they DON’T crumble ! Arteza colouring pencils are always highly pigmented , I owe also the old 72 count pencil set with smaller cores, this 120set goes a step further , 4mm cores !  You have every colour you will ever need in the beautiful Owl box , my only regret are those horribly flimsy plastic trays. There are 5 of them , colour swatches are on the bottom of the box and inside the hinged cover with names and numbers .  The pencil have on them self their name ,number  & COLOUR FASTNESS . The paint on the pencils is quite correct with the cores . The names ,I wonder who find them in the team ......KOALA GREY, COYOTE BROWN, MARMALADE ORANGE , FRUIT PUNCH , PEACHES AND CREAM  AND  NOW ONE OF MY FAVOURITES :  UNICORN PURPLE !!!  There is not one split pencil in the set.  I had a slight problem with my first set , the Customer care is second to none !  The next day was a brand new perfect set delivered !  I contacted the Arteza team by e-mail and in minutes they responded in minutes. Without any fuss or faff the wanted just my address ,where to send a new set .I owe also smaller sets of polychromos they are without a doubt good pencils , but not for me .  I  prefer how Artezas behave , and also price wise Polys are about £ 157 and Artesas £60 . Both are 120 count . I’m not an artist , but I like drawing and colouring . I was hesitating to buy the big Arteza set because I owe at least twelve big sets from all around the world , but my prefered pencils are Arteza , if possible I would give 10 stars to the pencils & 10 stars to the Arteza Customer Service !!! Thank you ARTEZA for Your beautiful products and Your exceptional Customer Care !
date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 December 2023

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: 柔らかくて塗り易い
review: 絵画教室を開いていますが、通ってくる小学生（高学年）のために購入しました。それまで長いこと安くて硬い色鉛筆を使わせていましたが（一本50～100円）、何年も努力を続ける子どもの姿を見て、もっと色馴染みと発色の良いものを使わせてやりたいと思い、このセットを用意しました。色数が多いうえ、「柔らかくて塗り易い！」と喜んでくれました。画材がいいと腕も上がりますから、この先の作品がますます楽しみになりました。

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great colored pencils
review: For me, not an artist at all,but love to color and make beautiful things.These colored pencils are great. They are super smooth and soft and they blend super!I had a problem with 3 pencils were the leads broke everytime i sharpened them,  i messaged and asked Arteza if they could send me the 3 colors, but they refund me the total costst of the 72 pencils, which is GREAT service!I now ordered the 120 pencils, more colors to come  🥰🥰🥰I recommend these pencils for people who love to color in adult coloring books
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 June 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
review: Sono delle matite colorate a base di cera. Ho acquistato la versione da 72 colori e sono soddisfatto. Hanno la scatola in alluminio ed i colori sono posizionati all interno con appositi raccoglitori. Si temperano bene ed i colori hanno una buonissima resa.  Su fogli dedicati da 220 g si possono sovrapporre più strati. In questo caso è opportuno iniziare dai colori più chiari e strato dopo strato aggiungere i colori più scuri. Usando una pressione leggera i colori si fondono bene tra loro mentre usando una pressione forte si rischia di saturare il foglio rendendo poi difficile aggiungere altri colori (poiché scivolano sulla cera compatta). Si temperano bene e nonostante siano a base di cera presentano una consistenza non del tutto morbida che li rende idonei anche ad effettuare i dettagli. Sono ottimi anche ad uso amatoriale e per colorare i mandala ma su fogli dedicati rendono bene epossono essere utilizzati anche per disegni complessi ( uso fogli satinato o grana fine da 220g) Difficile trovare di meglio a 37 euro. Buon divertimentoPro:Rapporto qualità prezzoBuonissima resaSono a base di cera e quindi fluidi e luminosiSi temperano beneBuoni sia per le stesure che per i dettagliBuona varietà di coloriContro:Sono a base di cera e quindi se si forza il colore c è il rischio che si crei una patina cerosa.Per rendere al meglio ci vuole un po' di esperienzaNon si trovano i colori singoliAll apertura della scatola si sente l odore di vernice...ConclusioniSono dei buonissimi colori dall' ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, perfetti per i principianti, ottimi per lo svago ma che risultano godibili anche dall' amatore esperto. Consigliati

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent quality, great price, minor problem
review: I'm a life-long devotee of Prismacolor, but my collection was getting nubbie and wasn't ready to invest in a new set. I decided to try Arteza, and was VERY excited and impressed as I started using them. Pigment saturation is great; super-easy to move it around and blend. I was particularly happy about the range of greens available (Always felt Prisma was thin on the green spectrum).Drawbacks: Metallics are usually rough and not very true regardless of brand, but these are pretty terrible. Gold ends up a sickly greenish/brown, and silver is, or course, gray. [Not a big deal because I don't use them much.] The one thing that DOES take Arteza down a notch from the professional-grade pencils is the lettering. Within a month of using them, the names were entirely rubbed off of the colors I'm using most often. First problem is placement: The color name is inked so it sits right in the curve of your thumb/forefinger, the second-highest wear point. [Prisma puts the name as close to the top of the pencil as possible.] Second problem is a combination of size and application. The lettering is large - which is nice at first - but it's all inked over the slick painted surface of the pencil. [Prismacolor goes the extra step of engraving the wood slightly before inking the lettering; you'd have to carve it off.] As problems go, it's not a huge deal. I keep a scribble sheet handy for when Turquoise starts to look Forest-y. Occasionally Black Cherry finds its way into the browns, but did any babies die? No. It's just fancy crayons.
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 1 October 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great value for money; exceptional set! Definitely better than Prisma's
review: Great customer service (when I had a fault, I contacted them and they resolved it without any dispute!) and really quick delivery (arrived next day!)...The pencils themselves are fantastic. In the past, I've had a set from WHSmith, Marco Raffine's and Prismacolours. This set far easily outstrips them all. The colour range (in the 72 set) is fantastic - couldn't ask for a better range, especially in the reds, pinks and purples that are lacking in some sets! The pencil core is slightly wider than what I've used previously, meaning you don't go through the pencil as quick. The quality of the wax is definitely better than either of the WHSmith or Marco Raffine sets. Prisma's are oil-based and finding these better than prisma's may be personal preference. I like to lay down a lot of colour when I'm colouring (I can be very heavy-handed), and this destroyed my soft-core prismas -- I just blazed through a very expensive set owing to how I colour. If you're like me, and lay a lot of colour down and like really sharp points, then these are a fantastic choice.When it comes to colouring, the blending and layering is equal to prismacolours and better than marco raffine. The wax in the marco raffine, I think, is slightly harder (and lays down a bit scratchy) which is more noticeable after you've used these.If, like me, you now find the market saturated with choices of pencils, pens and colouring book to satiate all colouring enthusiast appetites, you won't go wrong with this set. I did hesitate at first, owing to the cost and being not sure of the quality; however, you really won't be disappointed. The colours are bright, there's a brilliant range, they blend and layer really well, and are great value for your hard-earned income with excellent customer service: what more could you ask for from a set of pencils?

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great pencils at a great price.
review: Just received these pencils and I have to say I'm super impressed with their quality.  They arrived in pristine condition, safely nestled in their tin case within a cardboard sleeve and packed carefully in their shipping box.  I have many other brands of pencils in my collection, including Prismacolor Premiers and Faber Castell Polychromos and after testing these pencils, I can say they definitely hold their own against brands that cost a great deal more!  In appearance, they remind me a lot of Polychromos, with fully lacquered barrels in the colour of the lead and dipped ends.  The core is 4.5 mm thick so I expect these pencils will be quite durable.  Every pencil arrived in perfect condition, no cracked cores, no nicks or imperfections to be found.  They hold their points well, and don't crumble and break like Prismacolors often do.  The colour lay down is pretty effortless, they layer well, and the pencils are highly pigmented.  All in all, I'm VERY happy with my purchase and won't hesitate to purchase more Arteza pencils in the future.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 August 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Très satisfaite des crayons de couleur arteza
review: Très satisfaite de mon achat. J'aime beaucoup ces crayons de couleurs. Le rapport qualité prix est raisonnable. Je trouve les crayons arteza magnifiques. J'apprécie que les références inscrites sur les crayons soient numérotées et nommées. Le fait qu'il y ait une indication + pour leur résistance à la lumière est très appréciable. La mine est assez grasse et crémeuse. Le nuancier de couleur est assez bien pensé. Les couleurs sont intenses, lumineuses et assez couvrantes. Le soin porté à l'emballage est satisfaisant et la livraison rapide. Je recommande.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 March 2019

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Um lápis especial
review: Gostei dos lápis, vêm num estojo de metal, as cores são muito bonitas e fortes, como eu gosto. Mas agora eu compraria uma caixa com 120 lápis dessa marca.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Unschlagbares PreisLeistungsverhältnis
review: Wir haben die Stifte aus reiner Neugier heraus bestellt, da wir Künstlerstifte zu einem solchen Preis noch nie angeboten bekommen haben. Bei uns arbeiten die Großen mit Stiften in ganz anderer Preisklasse. Um der Sache gerecht zu werden muss man sie aber nicht nur mit hochpreisigen Buntstiften vergleichen, da sie doch etwas schlechter abschneiden, sondern eher mit normalen Buntstiften anderer Hersteller in der gleichen Preiskategorie. Dann schneiden sie nämlich bei uns mit sehr gut ab.Als unser Siebenjähriger sie gesehen hat, war er hin und weg. Auch seine Zeichenergebnisse sahen für ihn viel toller aus. Er konnte an jenem Tag fast gar nicht mehr aufhören mit dem Zeichnen.Zu den Stiften selbst konnten wir feststellen, dass sie sehr weich sind, eben Wachsmalstifte. Für Wachsmalstifte haften sie sehr gut auf Papier. Das Ergebnis hat satte leuchtende Farben.Natürlich reiben sich die Stifte aufgrund ihrer Weichheit etwas schneller ab, als normale Buntstifte. Mit einem neuen sehr gut schneidenden Metallspitzer konnten wir die Stifte ohne Probleme anspitzen. Es gab keine Mienenbrüche. Wir haben sie allerdings nicht zu spitz gespitzt, da bei der Weichheit eine feine Spitze zu schnell brechen würde.Als ein Stift bei uns unsanft auf harten Fliesen gelandet ist, war die Spitze natürlich ab. Aber vielleicht hilft da auch etwas Erziehung und Organisation. Wir Erwachsene legen unsere Stifte nach Gebrauch auch immer an einen sicheren Platz.Fazit:Zum Üben und für etwas ältere Kinder sind sie eine super Chance, um tolle Ergebnisse zu erzielen. Im Vergleich mit anderen Buntstiften in dieser Preisklasse schneiden Sie bei uns großartig ab. Daher gibt es von uns eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Me gusto
review: Llego a tiempo y en buen estado

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent product
review: High quality and a good value. These pencils lay down color very nicely, blend well and don't smear. The range of colors is fantastic and they sharpen perfectly with minimal loss. Highly recommended.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Not value for money
review: Not at all worth the price. Colours are bright but do not blend anywhere as close to prismacolor (but arteza price is comparable to prismacolors). After two applications colours stop layering (I used light pressure to apply on textured paper and without solvents). Too many shades of green. If you value money then don't go for it.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Go for it ig!
review: It was very good Quality and all but i recomend drawing with toned tan paper if you're looking for a style that'll make ir look better and more expert-ish.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: La mejor relación calidad/precio
review: Estos lápices son buenísimos por el precio que tienen. Tengo lápices caros (Policromos de FC) y otros más económicos (Zenacolor, Milan) y éstos son los que más me guastan de todos. Son cremosos, pero a la vez resistentes, se mezclan muy bien y la gama de colores es muy amplia. Los colores quedan muy vivos una vez aplicados. No soy profesional, pero la relación calidad/precio me parece imbatible. Compré la caja de 72 lápices y cuando vi que la de 120 estaba rebajada la compré sin dudarlo. Súper recomendables!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: These are great! Definetly worth it!
review: These pencils came in a nice packaged box with the colored pencils in a tin, they perform beautifully and are very pigmented. They don't really break that much, some colors are not as soft because of the lightfastness, and of course, prismacolors are better but these are great for an artist. They blend beautifully. I would advise you to swatch the pencils because the swatches on the tin are not really accurate. Very affordable and worth the money.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great for Adult Coloring Books
review: These are MUCH better than Crayola. More pigment, hardy, and good blending ability. If you're a professional artist, though, move on. These are not as good as Prismacolors, but still leagues better than Crayola. The 48 count is good enough for adult coloring (you can blend well and make other colors), but if you're lazy or aren't confident in your blending skills, get the 72.Great value for your dollar!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Absolutely worth the price!!
review: I am not a professional artist but do have enough art background and experience to recognize good quality products and tools. I have sets of very expensive professional level colored pencils, as well as kid level sets. I have sets made in Europe, Asia, USA...in other words, I have a LOT of colored pencils. I have been so disappointed with the quality of my most expensive set, breakage, unable to handle pressure, rough wood interior, cost per replacement pencil, etc. In a bit of desperation I decided to try these...and they are lovely!! The color line is gorgeous, they sharpen beautifully (small hand sharpener, not a regular pencil sharpener!!), the box they come in is well made (usually I recycle the box, but not for this set).  The lead is nice and thick, so for fine lines I do need to sharpen them, but they layer and blend so well!! The color name is on each pencil, which helps with remembering which colors I use. They came pre-sharpened, so the first needed sharpening is very easy. The wood inside seems to be very smooth so it doesn’t catch on the sharpener blade. The lead is on the soft side, so very fine lines might benefit from a harder lead, but they sharpen so easily that it is not difficult to get a nice thin line.I’m sold on these pencils and highly recommend them.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 November 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buenos lápices pero no han cumplido mis expectativas
review: Tengo bastante lápices de distintas marcas, mas profesionales y no tanto. Soy dibujante y me gustan probar cosas nuevas como lápices sobre todo. He oído sobre la marca Arteza diferentes opiniones y me decidí arriesgarme adquiriendo una lata de 72 lápices porque  costaba 0,51€ / unidad.La lata es muy bonita y compacta, parece ser durable. Los lápices están puestos en 3 pisos y sobre la tapa de la lata por dentro está la carta de los colores(72) puestos con sus números, el nombre en inglés y el rango de resistencia a la luz. En general son blandos, los colores son bonitos aunque haya según mi opinión muchas rosas y no son para aquellos a quienes gustan colores neutros.  Las minas son resistentes y pone que miden 4mm.  Para papel blanco están adecuados(hice mi carta de colores sobre papel color natural(sketchbook de la marca Hahnemühle con gramaje de 140g/m²). He podido hacer dos capas en general y no estoy muy satisfecho . Esta escrito que se pueden usar también  para el papel negro, por esto hice la prueba( 4ta foto) y me quedé decepcionado porque no sale como en la foto que ha puesto la marca(hice prueba sobre papel color negro de Talens(Black sketchbook de 140g/m²). Sobre todo los amarillos y rojos se ven fatal!  Así que no lo recomiendo(dibujar sobre papel negro). Además la mayoría de los colores de los lápices no coinciden con el color de su tinta(ejemplo fuerte el color Coral/A203/!). Te salvan los números en este caso.No me quedó claro la resistencia a la luz, ¿Cómo esta hecha? Y porque estos lápices son profesionales, tampoco. Probablemente por esa razón(resistencia a la luz).En dos palabras: los lápices no son malos, al revés, (tienen buen pigmento) pero sirven para trabajos no profesionales y si no se quiere gastar una fortuna. Aunque seria mejor que cuesten menos.Han llegado rápido y en buenas condiciones.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Spitze in Preis/Leistung, gut zum Malen auch für Fortgeschrittene
review: Nach den Bewertungen hatte ich sehr weiche Stifte erwartet. Leider kenne ich die teure Konkurrenz nicht, weshalb ich nicht sagen kann, ob die Arteza Colored Pencils Expert nun weicher oder härter sind als die von F.-C. - sie kommen mir jedenfalls nur ein wenig weicher vor als Billigbuntstifte vom Discounter.Aber je länger man mit einer Farbe malt, desto mehr lässt sich davon auftragen (eine Frage der Temperatur?). Geschickt zum Mischen bzw. nicht gleich den gesamten Bereich mit nur dieser Farbe füllen! Etwas mehr Deckkraft hätte ich mir von der Schwarz erhofft, egal wie lange man auf der Stelle malt, es bleibt das Papier darunter leicht körnig sichtbar (auch ein Grund, weshalb ich nicht glaube, dass die Stifte so weich sind, wie sie sein könnten). Die Weiß überdeckt bisher keine der Farben. Sie ist wohl nur auf dunklem/farbigen Papier anwendbar.Sicher lässt sich das durch einzelne Zukäufe ergänzen, so wie auch mehr gute Hautfarben. Hautfarbe für helle Typen gibt es 3 (A022 A034 A010) - daher hab ich beim anhängenden Bild viel gemixt, vor allem mit Hellgrau, Ocker und einem Gelbrot. Dennoch ist die Farbauswahl zu diesem Preis ganz prima und ich möchte die Stifte nicht mehr hergeben.Zur Brüchigkeit kann ich bisher nur sagen, dass ein Stift bereits mit abgebrochener Mine geliefert wurde, nach dem Anspitzen aber hielt. Andere angespitze Stifte sind auch bisher nicht gebrochen. Ich hoffe, dass das so bleibt. Nach kürzlicher Erfahrung mit ständig brechenden Kohlestiften im Spitzer kann ich empfehlen, einen Spitzer für Schminke (Kohlkajal) zu verwenden, da diese den Stift offenbar sensilber anspitzen.Gut finde ich, dass Arteza auf den Stiften auch die Deckkraft von + bis +++ ausweist, leider hat sich das in der Praxis aber als nicht so ganz stimmig erwiesen, da manche weicheren Stifte mit weniger Deckkraft, die härteren mit mehr Deckkraft überlagern. Aber das ist nicht bei allen Farben so. Habe daher mein dahingehuddeltes Farbchart nicht um die Deckkraft ergänzt, wie ursprünglich geplant.Wenn ich jetzt noch wüßte, wo ich einzelne Farben nachkaufen kann, wäre ich rundum glücklich. So bin ich es immerhin so sehr, dass ich mich mal bemühe diese Bewertung zu schreiben :-)p.S.: Das Foto mit den Stiften ist entstanden, nachdem ich mir die Stifte sortierte, wie ich sie brauche. Geliefert wurden sie in anderer Reihenfolge.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Really good budget pens
review: These are good budget pens :). Fast delivery, super nice metal box the pens were in - However, they were the "clamps" (on the box) that would hold the lid with the box but the "clamps" was broken, so the lid went off completely every time I opened the box. But nothing that bothers me (The pens is in a pen case) - the pens are worth the money you pay  - you get a lot for the money I think :). The onely thing I thought was a little bit annoying, was the "plastic plate" (or whatever it is called) that the pencils were on (in the box) bc it was to thin and the "plastic plate" could barely lift up the pens on it, without having to drop the pencils every time. Well, that's all I want to point out, but I still want to say that everything else is just positive about these pens :). Just have to say that the names of the pens are just too cute/funny, haha!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excelentes sus graduaciones en barril.
review: Excelentes colores. Buena manufactura y lindas tonalidades. Con suficiente suavidad.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Schöne Farben
review: Sehr schöne Stifte und Farben, lassen sich auch gut vermischen. Ich finde es jedoch schade, dass es nicht die Möglichkeit gibt bestimmte Farben wie Schwarz nachzubestellen, da sich diese schnell abnutzen und ich mir nicht erneut ein ganzes Paket kaufen will.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 February 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: I’m satisfied with customer service.
review: The set I got had blending and water-solubility issues. As they are, I’d categorize my set as a craft-level set, not a professional-level set. Nice pigmentation but limited usage (yes to coloring and cardmaking, no to blending gradients or multimedia work). Annoyingly, water doesn’t move it enough to use as watercolor pencils, but it moves it enough to smear the artwork. I’ve never been able to get a nice dry blend from watercolor pencils, which must have been the accidental mix-up that happened here (I think they crossed formulas accidentally). I have received a refund, Arteza has good customer service. But they also said they aren’t sure when the issue will be fully solved, so maybe don’t order these pencils for a while just to be save. I am satisfied with their customer service. I will have to reorder these maybe next birthday.The 72 set currently is on sale enough to make it crafting-level pricing, if you’re a crafter with no need for blending/gradients and water-related uses (multimedia, resist, use both sides of the paper). The 120 set is a bit pricy for craft-level supplies as of yet, for the specific set I received. There have been some awesome reviews, over years, so it’s probably just the one batch. Still, buyer beware. But great customer service.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Amazing colored pencils
review: These are amazing colored pencils. They blend nicely and are pretty pigmented, but unfortunately I have 4 pencils out of my 72 set so far that the lead keeps breaking. I am not sure if it is because the courier that delivers packages to me just tosses them from about 2 feet away from the door on to my concrete entry way (I have 3 stairs I guess they don't want to walk up).

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Very good price for quality
review: They blend very well, the pigment is great too. I love this set because the quality is great and the price is low. Some leads break kinda fast though, but its not a big issue for me personally.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 February 2021

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: O produto é maravilhoso.
review: O produto é muito bom, houve um problema na entrega mas foi prontamente resolvido tanto pelo assistente da Amazon como pelo vendedor, foram muito prestativos e interessados em resolver meu problema.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Colori accesi e forti
review: Questo sicuramente è un buon kit per chi intende spendere poco rispetto alla media; all’interno della confezione (molto bella) troviamo 72 matite colorate. Il tratto è morbido, non c’è bisogno di un eccessiva pressione per la saturazione del colore. Niente male
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 1 May 2022

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent pencils
review: These pencils are richly pigmented, and have a creamy core that blends beautifully, while still holding a point much longer than other wax-based pencils. These pair well with Prismacolors, but are gorgeous on their own. The best part about these pencils is the customer service this company provides—Arteza is responsive and helpful regardless of your issue. I would recommend these to beginners, as well as fellow illustrators!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: excellent quality
review: these pencils are pro quality...they flow well, have great color pigment and are easy to use.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Excellent crayons très bonne pigmentation bien glissant et gras type cire
review: Tout d'abord je suis ravie pour le prix car j'ai attendu une offre promo très intéressante (autour  de 23 euros ce qui pour la qualité des crayons les vaut très bien). Cela faisait longtemps que je les voulais, car j'ai une grande collection de crayons de couleur (Prisma, Polychromos, Guang Hui, Caran d'Ache, Giotto etc....) et j'avais eu de bons échos sur les réseaux sociaux en coloriage art thérapie, à un moment donné (très vite d'autres marques prennent le relais d'actualité).Perso, j'aime l'esthétique des crayons déjà (très beau) ils sont numérotés (bon pour ma part j'utilise pas de nuancier donc..) et alors l'odeur est  à tombé. Elle a une odeur de beurre de cacao, quelque chose de gourmand et d'assez fort (c'est très entêtant on aime ou pas perso j'adore, car je supporte pas les odeurs chimiques...). C'est une odeur proche des Prisma mais en plus fort je dirais, et perso, moi ça me transporte quand je colorie ;)J'ai commencé à colorier sur un colo, mais aussi testé sur feuille blanche, une sensation assez grasse glissante proche des Prisma dans la sensation de coloriage (je me permettrais pas de comparer sur la qualité, car les Prisma niveau pigmentation et qualité sont biensûrs au dessus), une sensation très confortable agréable, et plus facile je trouve que les crayons plus secs avec une pigmentation aussi bonne (après question de goût).J'ai trouvé quand même des traits communs aux Prisma plus que dans d'autres marques.Maintenant, là où je suis un peu déçu c'est le choix des couleurs (trop de vert notamment...) et avec quasi dans chaque tonalité de couleurs 2 couleurs quasi identiques  (pas décelable sur la couleur des crayons ne correspondant pas du tout à la réalité des couleurs une fois colorié ). C'est une marque intéressante et de bonne qualité bon rapport qualité prix (j'ai aussi les feutres que j'aime bien mais moins aussi pour le choix des couleurs...), même si vous trouverez encore mieux pour ce prix avec plus de crayons, pour ma part, ceux qui aiment le côté gras des Prisma mais que vous ne pouvez pas vous offrir dans l'immédiat, c'est intéressant, et ou pour compléter ces gammes de crayons.Nul part il est indiqué qu'ils sont à la cire mais pour ma part je pense que oui, car ils correspondent en tout point à la sensation de glisser et gras que l'on peut avoir avec et que j'aime tant.Une gamme à compléter pour des amoureux des crayons et ou très bien pour commencer...

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Muy buenos lápices
review: Son unos lápices muy buenos en relación a su precio. Me recuerdan mucho a los Castle (que me encantan) y la verdad es que no podría decir cuales son mejores.... Mezclan muy bien y los colores son brillantes. Son los típicos lápices que los disfrutas mucho al usarlos. Tengo prácticamente todas las marcas de lápices, desde los más económicos hasta los más caros, y estos no tiene nada que envidiarles a los más caros como los Caran d'ache Pablo, Prismas, Faber Castell... Junto con los Castle creo que es la mejor compra que se puede hacer sin gastar mucho. Por otro lado, quedé también encantada por la rapidez con que llegó el paquete en perfectas condiciones; la fecha estimada era el 19 de abril y los recibí el 12 del mismo mes. También tuve suerte con el precio (60€ la caja de 120). En definitiva, aconsejo comprarlos.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 January 2024

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buenos y duraderos
review: Se entregan en una caja de metal muy práctica, son duraderos y mezclan bien. Si eres profesional se quedan algo cortos, sobre todo a la hora de mezclar, pero los colores son muy vivos y tienes una variedad muy grande.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Preis / Leistung Topp + Spaß beim Zeichnen
review: Hallo zusammen,den Geruch beim Öffnen kann ich nur bestätigen, allerdings ist er ziemlich schnell verflogen. Also die Stifte erst mal auslüften lassen ;-).Anbei habe ich einen Farbchart angehängt und eine Zeichnung, die eigentlich nur zeigen soll, dass man mit diesen Stiften auch schön verblenden kann. (Ein ähnliches Bild habe ich auch mit den Polychromos gemalt und keinen großen Unterschied festgestellt. Das ist natürlich nur mein subjektiver Eindruck. Was die Farbbeständigkeit angeht, kann ich leider auch noch nichts sagen).Die Stifte haben reichlich Pigmente und sind Wachsbasiert, daher auch nicht mit Wasser verwischbar (Dafür gibt es die Aquarellstifte :-))Die Farbe läßt sich auch mit leichtem Druck auf's Papier bringen (Ok, bei manchen Stiften einfacher als bei anderen)Für mich sind sie eine passende Ergänzung zu meinen anderen Stiften, da auch ein paar aussergewöhnliche Farben dabei sind.Zu diesem Preis kann ich die Stifte nur weiterempfehlen.Noch ein Tipp am Rande, auf YouTube gibt es KünstlerInnen, die diese Stifte genauer unter die Lupe nehmen und wirklich gute Bilder damit zeichnen.LG
