review: I absolutely love these pencils!! I'd have given them a 5 🌟 but while organizing the colours by the colour list it was missing 1 pencil colour and had doubles of others.Not a big deal there are many many other colours available to choose from!

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: La fantasia è l'unic cosa non compresa nella scatola
review: Se ripenso alle meraviglie che mia figlia è stata in grado di creare con questi colori, quasi mi commuovo. Una gamma completa per un ottimo prezzo e qualità più che buona. Siamo consapevoli che sul mercato esiste anche di meglio e più prestigioso ma con questi colori siamo già ad un ottimo livello!  Ci sono sufficienti sfumature per dare vita a disegni molto dettagliati con chiaroscuro, ombre, gradazioni di colore, spessore... Anche i colori per riprodurre la pelle umana consentono di ottenere un incarnato naturale... Insomma, la mia ragazza li usa ancora con molta frequenza (sebbene qualche colore l'abbiamo dovuto sostituire di altra marca per rimpiazzare le matite consumate) e con grande soddisfazione. Consigliato.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 July 2023

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: A Very Good Set with Caveats
review: First off this would be an excellent budget set for a child, or an adult who needs to buy budget priced pencils for their coloring books.  For those purposes I would highly recommend them.  The color choice in the 72 set is excellent, though some could use more depth in shade and I wish there were a really dark inky blue color, however this set is more than enough to blend and get colors you want.  They are very soft in lay down and sharpen to a nice point which does not easily break as some brands do.  They layer and blend reasonably well though not as good as my Polychromos do but I did not expect that at this price point.  I love some of the colors, the pinks and purples and greens are well represented.  The big downside to sets like this is that you cannot buy individual pencils when one wears out, this is a huge disadvantage to someone like myself.  I like to be able to buy only the colors I use the most as often as I need to without buying a whole set.  I got this set for travel purposes, and it will be great for that.  It comes beautifully packaged in a metal tin with 3 layers.  The metal tin is covered in cellophane and then put into a sturdy form fitting box and then shipped in the Amazon box.  Because of this the pencils arrived in one piece with no damage.  Kudos for the packaging.  I can certainly recommend these pencils and they would be great for anyone starting out or who does not want to spend a fortune.  All in all a very good buy and I do not think you will be disappointed as long as you understand these are not the same as Polychromos, or Pablo's or other high end brands.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Buen producto
review: Todo bien

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Arteza est devenue une marque de référence !
review: Je fais du coloriage pour adultes et je colorie quasi qu'aux crayons de couleur, et de ce fait j'en ai pas mal.Je coloris aussi bien aux prismacolors qu'aux polychromos ou alors aux pablos de chez caran d'ache.Mais alors là, je suis surprise par la qualité de ces crayons effectivement ils font penser à de vrais crayons professionnelles.Les couleurs se mélangent bien entre elles, belles pigmentations des mines, les crayons sont numérotés, se taille très bien avec le taille crayon à manivelle le Dahle 133,  je regrette seulement qu'il n'y en a que 72 tout comme les crayons aquarellables de la même marque et qu'on ne peut pas les trouver à l'unité car alors franchement ça serait top !Alors n'hésitez pas à prendre ces crayons de couleurs que vous soyez débutants ou confirmés en coloriage ou en dessins, vous ne serez pas déçus !Excellent rapport qualité prix !Je recommande +++
date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 September 2019

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Preis Leistung für die Anzahl der Stifte gut
review: Spitze der Stifte brechen schnell ab. Gute Deckkraft. Sehr kräftige Farben. Liegen gut in der Hand, sehr gut zum Zeichnen

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Great Variety and Excellent Customer Service
review: These are similar in hardness to Polychromos in my opinion, they are not a soft wax like Prismacolor for being wax. They do leave some crumbs if you use hard pressure but in my opinion don't crumble as bad as Prismacolor. They sharpen well. Good variety in colors Im attaching a color chart, very few colors had any similarity. Picture attached is colored solely with Arteza pencils, Gamsol and a burnishing pencil.  I love the bright colors of the barrels and would say most were true to the color of the lead. They blend well on their own as well as with blending agents such as Gamsol. They have a lightfastness chart on the back of the tin as well as the lightfastness rating on the barrel. Only con and its minor and more to personal likes is having the very end of the barrel covered over so you cant see if a core is centered. If you have any concerns don't hesitate to contact Arteza. This set arrived and had the names rubbing off where the engraving wasn't deep enough and they honored their 100% guarantee upon being notified and sent me a full replacement set.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Tres B bueno bonito barato
review: Bueno después de 4 meses usándolos mi opinión sigue siendo que en calidad precio siguen siendo buenos, sobre la exposición a la luz aún no puedo decir nada porque no he hecho pruebas, pero sinceramente me gustan mucho, por su buena calidad, cremosidad y sus colores vibrantes y no dejan huequitos en blanco. He probado en papel de block de dibujo canson de 180 gramos y he probado también en papel bristol y en ambos me gustan. Buena opción si no te quieres gastar mucho dinero y quieres calidad. Al lado de prismacolor o faber castell polycrhomos hay diferencia, pero obtienes resultados buenos igualmente.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: creamy smooth quality pencils for all artistic levels
review: These are quality pencils and the packaging is great, the metal tin keeps them secure. That’s a huge plus...So, I’ve used and own several brands of colored pencils, I’m not a professional artist.Although something went terribly wrong on my order and it took a long time to arrive originally was to arrive on 4th but arrived on evening of the 7th.. being a prime item and was promised delivery on 4th- that did bother me & chat was zero help.I want to specify Amazon chat not arteza.So shipping issues need to be approved on.ON THE PRODUCT NOW:)Worth the purchase-but price is a bit inflated in my opinion.Arteza should rethink this increase on price.Myself -if it continues to increase as it currently has been I won’t buy again. I’m partial to PRISMA, however,These are softer than most other WAX pencils on the market other than PRISMA premier. Thus giving Arteza an edge above others on sheerness and layering ability.These are quality I will give 5 stars on that.I noticed that some of the darker colors do tend to be harder leads and thus blending the darker ones lessens.They are a smoother lay down than other comparable brands.DO NOT confuse these with oil based or watercolor pencils as those are different and lay down differently. Arteza has watercolor pencils as well. Make sure you order correct as I have made that error 😂These are wax based.I’ve compared several brands to these and these are more like PRISMA than other brands.If I were comparing these wax based to an oil based pencil, Castle arts oil based run a close second in smoothness.. for an oil base brand.Anyhow, back to Arteza 😍The blunting of the tips I think is to prevent breaking during shipping so you’ll want to hone the tips by using them or a quick  mini turn in a sharpener will remedy it.I had no issue using my hand sharpener to do it, onlyTook one turn to achieve a point.These are harder leads BUT SOFT LET ME BE CLEAR THESE ARE VERY NICE CREAMY PENCILS and less breaking is a good quality on any pencil.So all In all these are worth the purchase for quality, blending and color ability.The colors are PHENOMENAL I love they differ in all aspects as they add more choices to my collection. So, you will be happy with these...Price point I’d definitely say is good but the recent increases has me a bit cranky.. I’d rate these around a 50-60.00 dollar USD for the 120 set. 80.00 seems a tad HIGH.But I’m not judging just one person’s opinion 😍You can’t go wrong purchasing these though, any artist expert or beginner would find these workable and desirable.I tried to purchase the 120 set as it was prime item and delivery was next day, however once order was placed it said it would be 5 days so that upset me and I cancelled it because that shouldn’t be happening on prime delivery items.I was very dissatisfied with that aspect and I couldn’t get a straight answer from Amazon.As I won’t let that reflect my product option 😎That issue shouldn’t really be sellers fault, I was bummed that I wasn’t able to get my 120 set as promised right now. But maybe I’ll try again in the future because these are EXCELLENT pencils.So if you need them ASAP ask about arrival time from Amazon I’m not sure if it’s due to holidays but it was upsetting I ordered them specifically because I was getting next day PRIME delivery And didn’t..And it’s unfortunate there seems to be some discrepancy on shipping.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 February 2020

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Fantastic pencil crayons
review: Absolutely amazing pencil crayons.Packaged and presented beautifully in a metal tin box. Each layer has 24 different shades of colours. Each true to its shade.Each colour blends perfectly. I love the way these work. The more you play with them the better techniques you find too. I found many ways to work with them once I started playing around.On different styles of paper and card you can get different effects. Its worth trying each to find your favourite to work with. My favourite being on the card in the picture above. They also work well on canvas card and watercolour card.These leave a stunning shine to the colours. No lines at all left behind, all blended well and they're smooth on most types of card.The pencils are very nice to work with. They do not scratch the paper, they're smooth and creamy and glide across the paper/card. The colour comes out really strong whether using it lightly or pressing harder for shading.I'm no artist, I love the draw and I get through pencil crayons quite quickly so I needed to find some good quality ones.Now these are creamy as I said, when doing deep colouring you can use up more pencil than you want to. I would prefer this and have a smooth colouring journey than cheaper pencils that do not give enough colour and leave lines behind!I did have an issue with my first box, the leads were broken within the crayons so when I was sharpening, they were falling out mostly. After speaking to arteza customer service via email, I received fantastic support and was sent a new pack straight away. My second pack has no issues.I would definitely recommend these pencil crayons. They really are amazing quality. True to colour. Work in many different ways. Brilliant customer service too.

prod_name: ARTEZA Colouring Pencils, Professional Set of 72 Colours in a Tin Box, Soft Wax-Based Cores, for Drawing, Sketching & Shading
title: Light fastness rating on the pencils
review: Tl;dr: just buy the premium ones, they're cheaper and for most people will do the trick, especially if you're looking for pencil crayons for colouring books.First of all, these pencils feel sturdy. That's probably due to their thickness being 4mm. If you used the premiums prior to these and liked their triangular shape you will be disappointed to find out that these ones are round.I made a little colour swatch sheet so I could familiarize myself with the colours but also what they look like when Gamsol (oderless mineral spirit often used for blending out pencil crayon) is used on them.A lot of the pencils are creamy feeling, some not so much (now I don't know if they correlate at all but I found the less the light fastness -more stars- the creamier the pencil, the more light fastness -less stars- the more gritty it was).As for if I would recommend this pencil crayon. Definitely. But I would recommend in this economy, saving your money where you can. If you are just colouring in a colouring book; then all you need are the premiums, or better yet get Amazon basic's 72 count wax pencil crayons. They are on par with Arteza's premiums. If you're selling artwork, or for whatever reason believe you need expert level quality pencils then you definitely won't go wrong with these.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 December 2020

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Really good for beginners, depends what kind of paper you get I find
review: Our first time painting - myself adult, and child who is a teenager.I find them easy to use and work really well.I would get decent brushes (fine tip) and decent paper. I picked up an extra pad at a local Michael's store for my teen, and that pad of paper - the pencils didn't work near as well on as some paper we got on here (just a stack) that was a better value. It was for watercolor too - so check reviews.I find it depends on the brush - I like a fine tip. These work really well.We did pick up some actual water-colours on sale and are having fun using both.I would recommend.

title: No son para profesionales, pero sirven bien.
review: Muy buenos para el precio. Tienen una curva de aprendizaje para no llevarte todo el color cuando aplicas el agua. Una vez que les conoces la maña son muy fáciles de usar. Los colores son brillantes, aunque no tan intensos como otras marcas de mayor precio. Para el rango de principiantes y aficionados que quieren probar la técnica o para artistas más avanzados que quieran agregar algunos detalles con lápiz de color a sus acuarelas, funcionan muy bien. Algunos colores se aplican más suave que otros por el pigmento que tienen.

title: Good product, good price, and eventually good service!
review: Initially what I received was the Colour Pencils not the advertised Watercolour Pencils - but the seller has now sent the Watercolour Pencils. The ordinary Colour Pencil seem quite good - quite strong colour give fair coverage. The Watercolour pencils are also good, with quite strong colour and dissolve/spread well when a wet/damp brush is applied. The seller kindly let me keep the wrongly sent item. Both are excellent value at these prices £2.99

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Good quality and a useful range of colours.
review: On the whole I am really happy with these pencils. I wanted a set that would be good for both dry and watercolour work and these fit the bill. I am more than happy with the quality. My only niggle is the difficulty I have in getting them to a really sharp point. I have tried various sharpeners and never quite managed to get them a sharp as I would like. It's not a big deal as a craft knife does the job. Otherwise they are excellent.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 11 August 2020

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Great water color pencils
review: These water color pencils are easy to use and a good assortment of colors. Great for beginners!

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Recomendables para principiantes, estudiantes o adult co loring.
review: Los compré para probar la técnica y la verdad es que por el precio que pagué,  están muy bien, a veces los ponen en oferta y conviene adquirirlos si eres principiante o estudiante y quieres probar este tipo de dibujo antes de invertir más dinero en marcas para profesionales. Los he usado en libros para colorear y te aceptan dos o tres capas en ese tipo de papel (bristol), lo que me gusta porque con acuarelas de pastilla o tubo la hoja se pone muy rugosa por tanta agua, en cambio con los lápices tengo más control. En papel de acuarela de 300 g también acepta algunas capas y puedes detallar el dibujo con otro tipo de lápices. Para activarlos uso el pincel con depósito de agua que ya tenía de la misma marca y la verdad es que me funciona muy bien. Los colores se vuelven vibrantes al contacto con el agua, sin necesidad de aplicar demasiado pigmento ni demasiada agua. Son un muy buen regalo para gente creativa. Estoy muy contenta con ellos y los recomiendo mucho.

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Du crayon à la peinture
review: Un set complet de crayons, aux couleurs vives. Solides et une bonne prise en main, les crayons étant de forme classiques, ils seront parfaits pour les enfants dessiner ou les plus grands pour les cartes du BAC de géographie par exemple.Etant aquarellables, les dessins deviendront des œuvres. Un chiffon légèrement humide suffitLes crayons, se gomme bien si cela n’est pas trop appuyé.Enfin, étant dans une poche robuste, pas besoin de trousse.

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: These are amazing.
review: I've never used watercolour pencils before, bought these on a whim because they were an incredibly low price.Well, these exceeded my expectations. They behave just like watercolours, except better. You can get very fine detail with these, they blend wonderfully, and - what I'm happiest with - they are perfect for creating a base sketch without risking smudging, or visible linework, like you get when using pencil/graphite.This set is a great intro to watercolour pencils, and probably a great set for an intermediate watercolourist as well.  I highly recommend these.

prod_name: Pentel Arts Watercolour Pencil Set - Assorted, 24 Count (Pack of 1)
title: Does the job just a bit hard
review: I found these weren't as soft as id have liked. Works ok on paper with some tooth, but struggled to get much on top of gouache or acrylic even with mat medium. Good on paper for drawing guides etc. I suppose it depends what you want to do with them, i should have looked for a softer pencil for what i wanted but at the price i can still use them on my base layer.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 May 2021

title: Super precio y de verdad estan muy cool

No soy un experto artista pero los recomiendo mucho para principiantes o para pasar el rato dibujando El precio fue lo mejor ya que el set de 12 los he visto mas caros en tiendas de arte.  Llegaron en tiempo y cuidadosamente empaquetados.

title: Brilliant pencils
review: If you into newspaper puzzles, then these pencils are for you.  Being B rather than HB , they do not indent or damage the newspaper so easily. Having an eraser on the end makes amending "guesses" a doddle without having to look for a separate rubber. The pencils are sturdy and sharpen well.

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
review: La matita in grafite STABILO Othello è nota per la sua alta qualità e prestazioni. La mina in grafite offre una scrittura fluida e una tratto uniforme, rendendola adatta per disegnare e scrivere. La matita ha una buona resistenza alla rottura della mina, il che la rende ideale per un uso prolungato. Il design ergonomico assicura una presa comoda durante l'uso. Complessivamente, la STABILO Othello è una scelta affidabile per chi cerca una matita in grafite di qualità per attività artistiche o scolastiche.

review: Ottime matite della Stabilo arrivate in due gradazioni: 3 B e 4 B. Principalmente usate per sottolineare o appuntare i libri che leggo.

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Guter Bleistift für die Schule / Geometrie-Unterricht, Verpackung instabil
review: Mein Sohn benötigte für den Mathe-Unterricht Bleistifte der Härte H und da er in einem Schuljahr immer mehrere Bleistifte verbraucht, verliert, verlegt oder verleiht, kam mir dieses 12er Pack gerade recht.Die Stifte liegen gut in der Hand und lassen sich sehr gut anspitzen, ohne gleich abzubrechen. Der Härtegrad passt, so dass man damit auch gute Zeichnungen im Fach Geometrie anfertigen kann.Die Schachtel kam bei uns zerdrückt an, was aber der Verpackung von Amazon geschuldet war. Die Schachtel wurde in einem Kartonkuvert verschickt und dabei zerdrückt. Da ich die Stifte aber nicht in der Verpackung verschenken will, beeinträchtigt die zerdrückte Schachtel nicht meine Zufriedenheit mit den Stiften.Für Geometrie sehr gute Stifte, die ich bestimmt wieder kaufen werde.

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Bien arrivé
review: Bons crayons, bien arrivés. A nous les futures attestations !

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Sehr brüchig
review: Ich habe mit diesen Stiften mehr Zeit mit Spitzen als mit Zeichnen verbracht. Sie sind komplett unbrauchbar da die Mine ständig beim Spitzen abbricht. Es kann natürlich auch sein dass sie beim Transport so stark beschädigt wurden.

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: crayons gras conformes mais pas de taille crayon adapté
review: Pour une écriture effaçable et lisible, pour dessiner, rien de mieux que les crayons gras qu'on ne trouve plus dans le commerce ordinaire. Mais la taille de ces crayons est différente des crayons ordinaires et tailler avec un couteau s'avère périlleux et gaspilleur.Certains fabricants de crayons fard mettaient des tailles crayons à chaque crayon, une bonne habitude qui s'est perdue...

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Enveloppe correste mais dedans un seul crayon et cassé
review: C'est un peu invraisemblable, non seulement dans l'enveloppe dans ma boite aux lettres il n'y a qu'un seul crayon mais en plus cassé.

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Un produit de qualité !
review: Bjr,Arrivée en 3 jours 6 juillet 2019 RASProduit bien fini, de qualité, plus fin, plus souple et plus agile que les crayons habituels.La dureté ''H'' me semble plus appropriée aux travaux scolaires que le ''HB'',les cahiers restent plus longtemps propres , les mains aussi et le taillage moins fréquent.Dimanche 14 juillet 2019 > je rajoute :Coté parallèle 7m/m sur les 8 m/m habituel, ce crayon devient plus mal aisés à tailler !db, Arch. qualité

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: Item not as described!
review: Took delivery of these pencils late this afternoon. Delivery extremely good, but the pencils are not as described. The item description states that these pencils have a “practical erasure at the end”. Furthermore, one of the customer feedbacks also refers to them having an eraser at the end, when they clearly do not. All very disappointing, as they were bought especially for completing crossword puzzles.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2020

prod_name: Graphite Pencil - STABILO Othello - Pack of 12 - 2H
title: leider kaum zu gebrauchen - Spitze bricht immer ab
review: "Ein Sparpack Bleistifte für das Schulkind" dachte ich mir, "damit immer genügend vorrätig sind" ...nur leider dezimiert sich der Bestand drastisch, da beim Spitzen ständig die Spitze abbricht und auch das Holz splittert permanent! Egal wie sanft oder vorsichtig man dreht oder wie viele unterschiedliche (neue!) Spitzer man benutzt - die Spitze bricht permanent ab!! Für mich sind das absolut unbrauchbare Bleistifte von minderwertiger Qualität - trotz des namhaften Herstellers! Da kaufe ich lieber wieder direkt beim Schreibwarenhändler zum teureren Preis! Wirklich schade!

review: ８Ｂが入っていたので購入しました。

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: One of the better pencils you can buy
review: I prefer the their quality, you can sharpen and I haven’t had it break inside the wood body like some causing the broken piece to fall out and you need to sharpen a lot off to use. I also like having the pencil marks (HB, B2, etc.)  all the way around, helps to find the hardness I want quicker, not that I am speed drawing lol.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Iconic pencil
review: These are excellent premium quality pencils by Staedtler for sketching. There are 12 x 8mm pencils in total ranging from 2H to 8B. The degrees of softness are: 2H, H, F, HB, B, 2B, 3B, 4B, 5B, 6B, 7B, 8B. They are presented in a nice metal tin which provides good protection and easy access. The highly distinctive blue, silver and black top livery is iconic and it hasn't changed in years.I have used these pencils before and they have never let me down. This set is excellent for building up tone in portrait or landscape sketches for example. They sharpen well without splintering, and are comfortable to hold and use. The graphite is super smooth on paper and does not scratch at all like cheaper pencils. The graphite also erases easily so you can perfect your work. There is something very nice and satisfying about a good quality pencil like this one. This is a great set for any artist or student alike. Recommended.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2015

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Best Art Pencils
review: I have been using this brand for many years. It's quality pencils.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Noir c'est noir...il y a encore de l'espoir ¨¨
review: Si vous cherchez un mix entre le fusain, le crayon fusain & le crayon graphite, alors ces crayons sont faits pour vous !Enrichis en carbone, les noirs sont vraiment très profonds. Les crayons sont jolis & solides, et la boite en métal qui leur sert d'écrin est vraiment "collector" tant elle est jolie.Aux personnes qui souvent disent, il n'y a pas de différence en ces crayons & la gamme de 9000 de chez Faber Castell, je répondrai que si, il en existe une, même primordiale : l'on peut regarder ses dessins sous tous les angles, il n'y aura pas ce fâcheux effet brillance, ici le dessin est mat, et d'un noir soutenu...Bref, du Staedtler pur & dur !Sur les photos de mon dessin en cours de création (Le Roi Grizzly), je n'ai utilisé que des Lumograph Black du HB au 8B.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Beautiful quality pencils.
review: Beautiful and quality pencils. These pencils are pretty much the benchmark for their quality of material and standard tonal values I.e. the blackness/hardness. The casing material is of great wood quality.Mars Lumograph 100 series pencils have a little metallic lustre when drawn on paper. So, if you don't want any metallic shining on your drawings then you can buy Lumograph Matt Black series pencils instead. Both kinds have their particular usefulness and none of it inferior to the other. I love these pencils for technical drawing purposes.I recieved the box in time and in a packaging of amazon polybag. The tin box has a little dent on it but that's okay. One of the pencils (F grade) seems to have manufacturing defect. It seems it was broken and then was glued and painted over it. So that can possibly be a disappointment once I use the pencil enough to reach the point of the wood cleavage and if then it happens to be unusable. However, there is no match to staedtler for quality art supplies for professionals.An advice to beginner artists: it is always advisable to start your art journey from average quality and cheaper pencils as long as their tonal grades are consistent. I highly feel that expensive pencils are meant for professional artists if money is a constraint. Once you graduate into a better and experienced artist, go ahead and buy these beautiful standard pencils.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Verdaderamente negro
review: He probado muchos lápices que prometen un grafito más oscuro, pero que realmente no pasan de ser un gris más oscuro.Por otro lado están los de carbón que no se integran con el el dibujo de grafito.Estos están a la mitad. Muy recomendables.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Staedtler Mars Lumograph Black: finalmente ombre nere e opache !
review: Ho acquistato queste matite Mars Lumograph Black perché ero rimasto molto contento della grafite 8B della stessa marca, contenuta nell'ottimo set da 12 Mars Lumograph "normali", anch'esso in vendita su Amazon.In effetti, questa grafite Mars Lumograph 8B è particolarissima. Molto nera e quasi "grassa", è poco cancellabile come se fosse una matita colorata ed in breve è diventata la mia preferita (allego la palette dell'intero set, a lato di un piccolo bozzetto che feci tempo fa per esemplificare l'uso delle varie gradazioni di grafite).È allora che sono venuto a conoscenza di questo nuovo tipo di matite della Staedtler, sempre Mars Lumograph ma di tipo "Black", anch'esse in grafite ma di colore molto più nero del normale per la presenza di una più alta percentuale di carbone; vedendole in vendita qui su Amazon, le ho acquistate per curiosità.Fatta esclusione per la 8B del set Mars Lumograph "normale" che è del tutto simile con la 8B di tipo "Black", le altre gradazioni non sono da confondere però, in quanto a resa grafica, né con quelle in normale grafite né con le matite a carboncino.Delle prime non hanno quei fastidiosi riflessi lucidi avendo una finitura opaca, e delle seconde non possiedono la friabilità propria del carbone.Sono pastose e poco cancellabili come se fossero delle matite colorate nere, ma a differenza di queste sono sfumabili anche con le dita, hanno una mina resistentissima e molto affilabile, e soprattutto sono di quattro gradazioni diverse: la confezione comprende due matite di gradazione 2B, due 4B, una 6B e una 8B.Io le uso spesso e con piacere perché queste matite Black consentono agli amanti di questo tipo di tecnica, semplicemente ripassando un sottile strato sulle zone fatte con la grafite normale dove si vuole che sia reso un nero più profondo, di attenuare anche l'effetto lucido tipico della grafite.Queste Mars Lumograph Black sono un complemento anche per chi ama disegnare con il carboncino: le rifiniture, i particolari e le ombre più scure possono essere aggiunte con profitto dopo la stesura del fissatore ottenendo risultati molto convincenti.Allego tra le immagini il confronto tra la matita Lumograph in normale grafite di gradazione 8B e la sua "gemella" 8B Lumograph Black: entrambe hanno la mina di diametro maggiore delle altre gradazioni: ben 4,5 mm., mentre per le Black 6B, 4B e 2B il diametro è di 3,6.Le Mars Lumograph Black sono contenute in una pratica scatola metallica con una funzionale cerniera apribile (molto comoda per coloro che disegnano sovente anche all'aperto o in altre svariate condizioni ambientali), ed inoltre, al di là dell'abituale eleganza, riportano intelligentemente su ognuna delle sei facce la gradazione (caratteristica comodissima per un disegnatore).Consiglio a tutti gli appassionati di disegno, professionisti e non, l'acquisto delle Lumograph black, perché la resa è in definitiva qualcosa di diverso: diverso dalle grafiti, diverso dai carboncini, diverso dalle matite colorate. Si ha un ibrido di cui davvero si sentiva la mancanza a livello grafico.P.S.:Ora che sto scrivendo noto che ne hanno prodotto un kit in cui le matite Lumograph Black sono tutte di gradazioni diverse, avendo aggiunto la HB e la 7B: le acquisterò non appena "nanizzate" queste.Spero di esservi stato utile.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Great art pencils
review: The original Staedtler Lumograph 7B (EB) was always my favorite but the 7B & 8B (EE) never quite fit in with the rest of the Lumograph drawing pencils, they were a carbon & graphite mix while the rest of the grades are graphite. Having them split into two lines gives so much more options. They are nice & dark, as dark as Cretacolor Neros & darker than Faber Castell Matte but not as smooth as either, you can feel just a bit of grab on the paper. You can erase but minimally & smudging/blending with stumps or tortillons is also minimal but that helps make sketchbook drawings stay less messy. This is a great & useful addition to any drawing toolkit.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 January 2024

title: Nice & dark carbon pencil
review: Nice mars carbon pencil.8B is very dark pencil & also can be used over the graphite pencil with no any dust.These are adhesive with drawing surface so u can not blend well. Useful for dark portion of drawing.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Simplesmente perfeito para quem gosta de desenhar
review: Estava acostumado com outra marca, mas agora só quero saber desses lápis, não consegui parar de usar desde que comecei. Entrega rápida, bem embalado, produto da mais alta qualidade. Meu filho também gostou.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Mejores cuanto más los usas
review: He usado todo tipo de lápices 'negros' para los tonos oscuros, desde grafitos de distintas marcas, pasando por carbones normales, comprimidos, grasos, los Conté 1720, pasteles negros ... Bien por vaguería o porque soy demasiado principiante para darme cuenta, voy buscando un tipo de lápiz que me permita negros intensos, pero que luego no tenga que andar con fijadores para que no se me vaya o se traspase a la hoja de al lado. Los Conté igual se acercaban un poco pero siguen manchando allá por donde pasan.Estos cayeron en mis manos después de ver varios análisis. Al principio me resultaba algo extraña la sensación, ya que no son suaves como un grafito, son como una cera dura, pero los resultados me gustaron mucho. Alcanzan negros mucho más intensos que un grafito (aunque el Steadtler normal 8B no está nada mal) y no tienes ese brillo del grafito que puede ser molesto. A medida que los usas y te acostumbras vas obteniendo mejores resultados y te van gustando más. Se quedan bastante bien en el papel, no difuminan mal, no manchan ni necesitan de fijador. La cajita donde vienen en un buen detalle y el precio por 6 lápices está muy bien.Un excelente producto que va a gustar a los amantes del dibujo a lápiz.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Ottima qualità.  Set essenziale e utile
review: Prodotto di ottima qualità.  Il set non è completo ma sufficiente per il disegno.  Completare con una matita 3H e 10B.

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: No son muy baratos, pero tienen buena calidad.
review: En general estoy muy satisfecha con ellos. Los uso para dibujo y funcionan genial. No es que sean muy baratos, pues comparando con los de faber castell, por ejemplo, estarían en un rango similar, tal vez algo más económicos. Si eres de gastar muchísimos lápices tal vez no te saldría muy rentable, porque a fuerza de afilar y afilar se van desgastando pronto, sobre todo los que son de la B hacia abajo.Pero aparte de eso, lo dicho. Me parecen bastante buenos y manejables para dibujar. No sé cómo serán para escribir, pero supongo que estarán bien también. Tal vez vuelva a pedirlos el día que se me agoten, o intente conseguir sueltos los que más gasto, que serían el HB, el B y el F sobre todo, Y el 3B y 5B también les he dado caña para sombrear. Su madera también me parece bastante buena y no se rompen ni se astillan al sacar punta. Pero eso tampoco me ha ocurrido nunca con ningún lápiz staedtler, ni siquiera la gama escolar, los del nº 2 de toda la vida :)

title: 擦筆やティッシュだと光沢がでます。
review: おそらくこちらを買われる方は、グラファイト鉛筆特有の反射が嫌で買われてる方もおられると思います。確かに濃くなればなるほど反射しません。(HBはちょっとだけ反射します)しかし気をつける点があり、8Bを擦筆やティッシュなどで擦ると、グラファイトと同じく光沢がでます。ちなみに擦っても全然ボケないしのびません。描き手が鉛筆の特性を理解して描く必要があります。唯一指で擦ると伸びますし、ボケます。手が汚れていいなら最初から木炭やコンテを選びそうですが。書き味の滑らかさでいうと、ハイユニやステッドラー青の滑らかさはなく、ユニなどの書き味よりも更に引っかかり感が強いです。

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Non proprio nere
review: Bellissime matite ma purtroppo avendo sempre un po’ di grafite all interno le gradazioni più dure creano sempre l effetto  un po’ lucido ma dalla 4b all 8b iniziano ad essere davvero scure…sembrano carboncino…le preferisco al carboncino perché si temperano tranquillamente senza rovinare la punta….se si vuole un effetto più opaco è importante per le gradazioni più dure di essere più leggeri nel tratto…comunque ne vale la pena usarle

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Great set!
review: I'm using this to start to relearn drawing. The wide range of the pencils are a great help in getting dark tones. 4B and 6B are my favorites!

prod_name: STAEDTLER 100 G12 S Mars Lumograph Graphite Pencils for Drawing & Sketching - Assorted Degrees, 8B-2H (Tin of 12)
title: Preis- Leistungssieger
review: Das Produkt ist ab und zu für einen unschlagbaren Preis zu haben und mein persönlicher Preis- Leistungssieger.Im Vergleich zu noch günstigeren Alternativen ist hier das Holz aus PEFC-zertifizierten, nachhaltig bewirtschafteten Wäldern und auf der Dose prangert ein "Made in Germany".Schaut man zum teureren Konkurrenzprodukt "Castell 9000", empfinde ich die Staedtler Bleistifte insgesamt als etwas weicher. Ebenso wurden hier die Härtegrad 6B, 7B und 8B mit einem abweichenden stumpferen Winkel (30°) gespitzt. Ein Spitzer mit 23° und 30° Winkeln wäre also bei der Verwendung von Vorteil.

title: 白のチャコールペンシルが欲しくて買ってみたが. . .
review: ダーウェントの白のチャコールペンシルを試してみたくて買ってみましたが、正直私が期待してたのとはちょっと違いました。目や髪を描く時に黒いチャコールペンの上からハイライトとして使いたかったのですが、ダーウェントの場合色が薄くブレンダーペンシルのようにボヤけて黒と混ざってしまいます。対して他社製品の白いチャコールペンは黒色をはっきり覆い隠すぐらい濃いです。（写真参照）描き味もダーウェントの場合はザッザッザッという音がして黒板にチョークで描いた時のような感じてしょうか。描き味は人の好みなので他社製品との優劣は比べられませんが、私は少々値段がお高めなダーウェントに期待していただけに少しがっかりしたというの正直なところです。ダーウェントは紙に引っかかるような描き味が好きという方にオススメです。ただ、白は他社製品の方がいいと思います。

prod_name: Derwent Charcoal Drawing Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 6 with Sharpener, Light, Medium, Dark & Tinted Charcoal White, Ideal For Blending & Smudging, Professional Quality, 0700838
title: Gut
review: Die Stifte sind in einer praktischen Dose verpackt und beinhalten einen Anspitzer für den die Stifte zu dick sind. Sie passen einfach nicht in das Loch und man kommt garnicht erst zum Anspitzen. Daher leider ein Stern weniger. Ich vermute die Stifte sind zu dick, denn sie passen auch nicht in den Kurzkonusspitzer von Stabilo welcher von einigen Zeichnern für Kohlestifte empfohlen wird. Zum Glück habe ich noch einen Anspitzer uzm Kurbeln, da bricht nichts ab :-)

title: Provide a proper sharpener
review: First things first. These are amazing for drawing with, i love them and will buy them again. Absolutely fantastic tondraw withMy issue is they come with a sharpener thats useless. The charcoal pencils are ok to sharpen to begin with but once you get into the pencil a bit, its not sharpening, its breaking off in the sharpener. So i will buy a better sharpener to see if this is a sharpening problem or a pencil fault but its an awful waste of pencil when the charocal keeps breaking and getting stuck

prod_name: Derwent Charcoal Drawing Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 6 with Sharpener, Light, Medium, Dark & Tinted Charcoal White, Ideal For Blending & Smudging, Professional Quality, 0700838
title: Buy them without second thought!!
review: See...ignore the other reviews,these are amazing and they aren’t rough nor scratchy they are solid pure charcoal better quality than generals.if you know what polychromos coloured pencils are,they are similar in the sense that prismacolor premier coloured pencils are amazing but the build quality is bad,and polychromos are better made and have better quality leads but a bit hard to use compared to  prismacolors similarly generals can be compared to prismacolors and derwents as polychromos.

prod_name: Derwent Charcoal Drawing Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 6 with Sharpener, Light, Medium, Dark & Tinted Charcoal White, Ideal For Blending & Smudging, Professional Quality, 0700838
title: Ottimo prodotto!
review: Ottimo set di matite carboncino. Una dura-hard o light, due medie o medium e due morbide-soft o dark. In più troviamo un pastello "Tinted" Charcoal White TC21, che può essere usato sia per saturare, sia come schiarente, sia come blender, a seconda che si usi o solo, o prima dei neri, o dopo. Con determinate tecniche risulta utilissimo. Infine il set ha anche un comodo e piccolo temperamatite, che fa bene il suo lavoro finchè si mantiene la lama affilata. La scatola di metallo è robusta, la classica Derwent per 6 matite più temperino. O si conserva nell'originale (nel senso che è fornita dal produttore) scatola di cartone, o le si tiene sempre avvolto un elastico intorno, per evitare aperture accidentali.

prod_name: Derwent Charcoal Drawing Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 6 with Sharpener, Light, Medium, Dark & Tinted Charcoal White, Ideal For Blending & Smudging, Professional Quality, 0700838
title: ダーウェント、良い仕事してますね
review: 普通のグラファイト鉛筆では得られない無光沢感が良い。ゼネラルやコンテアパリのチャコールペンシルは滑らかにするような粘土質の成分の配合がされているみたいだけど、ダーウェントのはそういうのがなくて乾いた感触の書き味でそこがまた良い。木炭や木炭のブロックと擦筆のセットになったセット品も買いましたがそちらも良いです。お買い得だと思います。より大画面に書きたい場合はセット版をおすすめします。写真にあるように軽く描いた程度なら消しゴムや練りゴムで消えます。消えにくいとおもっているひともいるかもしれないので参考までに。鉛筆よりもぼかし表現に向いた画材なのでいろいろ工夫するとカッコイイ絵が出来るとおもいます。

 I bought these pencils while they were on offer. I don’t really like them. The pencils snap when sharpening with a Stanley knife (the sharpener is useless like other customers have pointed out). prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Informationen
review: Ich bin zugegebenermaßen erst vor kurzem auf die Marke Derwent aufmerksam geworden, nicht aufgrund von Werbung oder Werbegeschenken, sondern weil ich schon lange eine gute Ergänzung zur Polychromos Palette suche. Vor zwei Monaten war ich wieder einmal bei Boesner, dort habe ich diverse Stifte ausprobiert und muss sagen, dass die Derwent Drawing super Stifte sind.Ich zeichne inzwischen seit 16 Jahren, habe bis jetzt viele Stifte ausprobiert und bin seit vielen Jahren ein Freund der Faber Castell Serie. Warum? Nun, Faber Castell liefert eine super Qualität, ich habe noch nie eine Palette gekauft in der ein Stift gebrochen / kaputt oder auch nur abgebrochen war, ich hatte noch nie Probleme beim Anspitzen, wenn ich FB kaufe, weiß ich was ich bekomme. Trotzdem suchte ich schon länger eine Ergänzung zu den Polychromos, dadurch habe ich einige schon bekannte Marken und Stifte ausprobiert:Caran d'Ache LuminanceSanford PrismacolorLyra PolychromosSchon vor längerer Zeit musste ich leider Koh-I-Noor den Rücken kehren, weil ihre Künstlerfarbstifte leider nicht mehr die besten sind (vom Preis her sind sie aber immer noch unschlagbar). Aus diesem Grund habe ich die Augen offen gehalten und habe bei Boesner durchprobiert, da ich selten etwas probiere und es sofort kaufe, habe ich die Stifte nicht direkt aus dem Geschäft mitgenommen. Stattdessen habe ich lange Zuhause gesessen und überlegt "brauche ich sie wirklich?". Ich bin niemand der gerne 30 verschiedene Paletten sammelt damit sie im Regal verkommen, ich kaufe meist nur Dinge wo ich wirklich sagen kann "ja, brauche ich auch in zwei Monaten noch".Hier einige Details zur Drawing Serie von Derwent:Die Stifte sind viel(!) weicher als Polychromos, sie sind sogar etwas weicher als Prismacolors, haben ein sehr schönes Farbbild, reiben sich aber bei weitem nicht so schnell ab wie die Stifte von Sanford. Was mich besonders positiv überrascht hat war, die Farbpalette der Drawing Serie: Hier gibt es sehr schöne natürliche Farbtöne, ich würde sie jedem empfehlen der gerne die Natur auf Papier bringt und zum Leben erweckt. Hervorragende Farben vorallem für Tierzeichnungen, da es schöne Brauntöne gibt, die bei den Polychromos hinten anstehen müssen, auch das Grau ist sehr schön (kalt und warm grau) und es gibt einige Farben für Details wie Iris (attraktives Grün, auch für Bäume gut geeignet), leuchtendes Gelb und beruhigendes Blau.Die Drawing Serie gibt es soweit ich weiß, nur in einer Ausführung von 24 Stiften (inkl. Weiß und schwarz). Ich muss aber sagen, das mir 24 Stifte völlig ausreichen, weil ich sie sowieso mit den Polychromos / Coloursoft gekauft habe. Für alle die gerne mit vielen Schichten arbeiten, habe ich eine sehr gute Nachricht: Obwohl die Drawing Serie (wie Coloursoft) auf Wachsbasis ist, lassen sich die Farben super layern - ich hätte an dieser Stelle auf keinen Fall erwartet, dass ich mit ihnen sogar mehr Schichten aufbauen kann. Im Grunde kennen es die meisten, die diese Rezension lesen werden: Fast alle wachsbasierten Stifte sind zum Layern nicht besonders gut, zwei bis vier Schichten sind oftmals noch in Ordnung, während man bei auf Öl basierenden Stiften gute acht bis neun Layer auftragen kann. Genau hier haben mich die Derwents am meisten überrascht, denn sie haben kein Problem bei zehn oder mehr Schichten, ich habe davor noch keine wachsbasierten Stifte gesehen, die praktisch ohne Waxbloom verarbeitet werden können.Zum Schluss muss ich noch kurz erwähnen, das man sich die Stifte um den Preis wirklich gut leisten kann, weil sie sich nicht extrem schnell abreiben wie diverse andere (Prismacolor vorne weg). Wer eine gute Ergänzung zu seinen (welchen auch immer) geliebten Stiften sucht, um bessere Hintergründe, mehr Schichten oder einen größeren Kontrast zu schaffen, der sollte hier zugreifen. Ich habe den Kauf nicht bereut, mir ist noch kein einziger Stift abgebrochen (ich spitze seit Ewigkeiten mit einem Faber Castell Spitzer und einer Dahle 133), ich habe bisher schon einige neue Bilder gemalt - teilweise auch nur mit den Drawing - trotzdem nutzen sie sich sehr langsam ab. (Um euch nicht zu verwirren, möchte ich sagen, dass die Fotos direkt nach dem Kauf entstanden sind).
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 7 December 2023

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: 絶妙なくすみカラー！
review: 色鉛筆といえば、手軽で使いやすい画材の代表で赤や黄色〜青や緑など、素直な色味のものというイメージがあったのですがこちらの色鉛筆はちょっと違い、ニュアンスのあるややくすんだ色で構成されています。抑え気味の自然な色味で、他とは違うシックな落ち着いた雰囲気が得られます。芯は太く（５mm）、柔らかいです。粉をワックスで固めた感じというか、どちらかというとマットな質感で、テカリはそんなにない感じ。何色か重ねると、スベってのりにくいことがあり、重ね塗りに向いてるとは言えないかも。とはいえ、私自身が何色も重ねて緻密に色味を作るような描き方を必要としない上、そのままの色味が十分に美しいので、たとえグリグリと無理やり重ねてタッチがヘンな感じになってもそれはそれで面白い効果になるようにも思います。（あくまで自分の場合）芯の太さと柔らかさから、細かい部分を塗るよりも勢いのあるドローイングで使ったら、なんかカッコよく描けた気になります。自然を美しく描きたいとか、古風な画面を作りたいとか、抑え気味の色味で個性を出したいとか、そういうのにもぴったりかと。とても好きな色鉛筆です。追記: 色の見本追加しました。公式サイトの色見本よりも、実物のほうが少しくすんだ色のような気がします。モニターにもよると思うので、参考程度に。本当にシックな良い色です。

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Cores terrosas de alta qualidade
review: O tamanho da mina garante a durabilidade. São lápis macios de textura quase cremosa, que recobrem bem o papel, e é possível criar camadas  e combinações interessantes. Os pigmentos de alta qualidade possuem tons básicos que permitem uma grande variedade de aplicações e temas... Achei particularmente interessante o efeito quando combinados com aquarelas

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Beautiful Pencils. Gorgeous Saturated Colours, are Creamy and Perfect for Nature.
review: Derwent Drawing Pencils are creamy, rich coloured pencils with a dreamy colour palate suitable for landscapes- nature studies, wildlife studies and portraiture. I had originally purchased the 6 pc set, just to try them out. Due to some of the issues I had experienced with the Coloursoft coloured pencils, I did not want to splurge on these just yet. Almost immediately I fell in love with them. These are richly pigmented, and when creating the swatches I knew I had to upgrade. The colours offered here in the 24 pc set (their largest) are gorgeous, earthy tones, and the performance of these pencils are outstanding. Rich pigments, vibrant colours that layer and blend exquisitely. Like the Coloursoft, and the Artists pencils, these barrels are thick, and the 5mm lead allows for a lot of pigment on that lay-down.The issues are minimal. Price - these are expensive. The prices here on Amazon are the best I was able to find and these pencils are worth the asking price. Another minor negative is the thickness of the pencils may get in the way when colouring in, or drawing the tiny details in your pieces. Also their largest set of 24 colours may be limiting to some, and although the colours offered here are just what’s needed for nature and animal studies, you may still be yearning for more colour options (as evidenced when drawing the unfinished dog attached. I had to default to the Coloursoft pencils for the tongue's red tones). These are meant to be more of a companion piece to your other Derwent pencils; Coloursoft, Artists, ProColour, so for further colour options, just reach for whatever set you have. Currently I own the Coloursoft (36), Studio (36), and Artists (72). The Drawing pencils are my favourite so far of the Derwent line.Overall, Derwent Drawing Coloured pencils are fantastic. The 24 pc set is what is recommended as you get the full colour palette in a convenient tin. These are my go to pencils whenever I want to draw anything with four legs and is covered in fur, and those soft, dreamy landscapes. Although these may not be the best pencils for colouring books due to their theme specific colour selection, they perform beautifully, laying down gorgeous and saturated colours, and is recommended for artists of all levels.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: The perfect sketching pencils!!
review: I prefer to sketch and draw with earth tone colors generally, and I’ve had a hard time finding good drawing pencils (as opposed to standard color pencils) in the right tones. These are great! Sanguine, Ruby Earth, and Sepia are EXACTLY what I was looking for. These are smooth, feel great on paper, and most of them are beautifully pigmented. The only ones I found to be a bit waxy and weak on color were Green Shadow and Solway Blue, but those aren’t ones I’ll probably use a lot so overall this set is perfect!

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Fantásticos, colores peculiares
review: Estoy encantadisimo de haber elegido esta marca, tenia otros de una marca famosa y están bien pero estos son sobresaliente, tiene unos colores impresionantes para mezclar, a mi me gusta la pintura de animales y estoy enamorado de los colores tan peculiares que consigo con estos lapiceros. Saco punta con un bisturí, al ser mina blanda no me atrevo a sacar punta con un sacapuntas. Lo dicho si alguien quiere unos lapiceros pastel estos son fantásticos. Compre el estuche de 24 y me arrepiento, de saber que iban a pintar también me hubiera pedido un estuche más grande.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Amazing Colored Pencils!
review: Years ago, I was introduced to Derwent Drawing pencils as part of a promo and received a 6 piece set through an art supply vendor. As a colored pencil artist, I was soon amazed at the quality, pigment and feel of these pencils. I liked them so much that I decided to recently upgrade to the full 24 set and saw that Amazon had a fantastic price.The colors in this set are subtle, beautiful shades that I could not find in other sets of popular pencils.  These pencils are truly the elite artist grade colored pencil, in that they are super creamy/waxy and pigmented and layer flawlessly. Though they appear to be marketed for rendering animals, they are equally impressive for rendering flesh tones, and architectural pieces. They work very well combined with other pencils and layer well with oil-based or wax-based brands. The sensory feel of these cross between a wax- based and oil-based colored pencil but with wider leads. From what I've observed, they leave no wax bloom or excessive residue. The pigments are intense that you can go over several previous layers of colored pencil (other brands) and easily leave rich, broad strokes.  They are perfect for final detailed accents on pieces. The Chinese White pencil in the set is also perfect for highlighting over layers of pencil, and covers well on darker papers.As for being erasable, they will erase to a certain degree on most paper. Though, they do so very well on black, smoother illustration board. They don't erase as well on other papers, but I find that if I apply them over subsequent layers of colored pencil, they erase better.For these pencils, paper choice plays an important role. They are bit too rich and bold for regular sketching/copy paper. I find that they work beautifully on vellum bristol, illustration board and erase especially well on black illustration board. They also hold up well on artist professional grade drawing paper that has a weight of 90lb or more. If you are trying to achieve a smooth finish, I probably wouldn't use these on general sketchbook or heavy, broad toothed paper or you will see a lot of the paper's texture.For the colored pencil artist or those with special interest in drawing, these pencils are very much recommended. They're well made, of excellent quality in durability and lightfast ratings (the colors won't easily fade) and the leads last a long time. *Important: You will need a wider hole pencil sharpener for these. Something metal and durable.The Derwent brand pastel pencil sharper is perfect for these pencils.I cannot say enough good things about these amazing pencils and am fortunate to have acquired the full set!

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Good selection of colours for drawing
review: I must now have five or six sets of Derwent pencils, but these, the latest are my favourites. They are a selection of browns, muted greens and blues, off whites and other naturalistic colours. For drawing and sketching naturalistic scenes I think they are a clever selection. You can always add others from the range for bright colours, but these bring a sense of understated beauty to your drawings.The pencils themselves are round with thick leads. they are quite soft - similar to Derwent's coloursoft range and do not hold a fine point for very long. I suggest that (1) you keep a good quality pencil sharpener close by and that (2) Derwent consider making a hexagonal finer leaded version for people who want to do detailed drawings.The colours, like most of Derwent's insoluble coloured pencils blend well if you don't put down too much at once. If you really scrub hard you'll end up with a slightly waxy bloom and it's difficult to put more colour on the top and blend the colours. Almost it acts like a wax resist when you try to pencil over, and definitely like a wax resist if you try to water colour over.If I have a problem with these (and for that matter, most coloured pencils) it's the white. It's pretty translucent. Which may be what it should be and maybe what you want. But I would like a white that was really opaque and you could use for highlights.In summary, if you're into naturalistic drawing these are a good selection and deliver; there's a smaller set for the cautious but I'm glad I got the whole 24.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Softest Coloured Pencils Ever!
review: These pencils are absolutely incredible! They have a fast lay down and blend out with oms very well. The Derwent Drawing Pencils are arguably the softest coloured pencils on the market. They do sometimes break but the quality of the pencils are very good so it doesn’t happen too often, unlike prismacolor.They come in a muted earthy palette suitable for landscapes, wildlife and portraiture. Because of this they wouldn’t be a great set to start off with but a set you would purchase once you already have an established coloured pencil set to use along side of them.All of them are highly lightfast with 23 scoring an 8 on the blue wool scale and one scoring a 7.Overall they are an extremely excellent pencil that I would recommend to almost any coloured pencil artist to add to their collection!

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: wonderful pencils for drawing fur
review: I recently purchased these pencils and I adore them.  I've used them on both pastel paper and bristol board and they worked fine on both.  The white and black in this line are really the best.  The black in this is much darker than my prismacolor black pencil.  These are much softer than prismacolor pencils.  Imagine a combination between prismacolor premier pencils and oil pastels.  I like the smudgy way they blend.  These however are not for everyone.  My prismacolor's hold a point better.  These would be rubbish for detailed adult coloring books because they do not hold a point very well.  People were commenting in the reviews that they liked them for portraits.  I'm a portrait artist and I've done a portrait with them but I didn't love them for that purpose.  They were perfect for drawing furry animals.  I love the color range.  It's really well thought out. Great greys for shadows.  I do not recommend these for lots of tiny detail work, you'll be wasting them sharpening like crazy.  I love these to pieces but will be buying some Faber Castell Polychromos for my most detailed work.Something important to know about these.  They are incredibly lightfast, that's not common for colored pencils.  All but one has the highest lightfast rating of 8 and the one that doesn't is a 7.  This is important to me because I sell my originals and wouldn't want my work to fade on my customers.These work great with my prismacolor pencils so I often use both in the piece.  The nose on the tiger drawing is the only part where I used prismacolor instead because there is no pink in the derwent drawing pencils set.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Nice soft pencils but split when sharpening
review: I liked the natural colours and the pencils are very soft (so more for colouring in than drawing as you can’t get detail with them being so soft). Was enjoying them until I tried to sharpen one (with a high quality sharpener) and the wood split. Maybe as the core is so thick the wood surrounding is thin meaning it breaks easily. Shame. Sent them back.

prod_name: Derwent Drawing Colouring Pencils, Drawing & Writing, Set Of 12, Ideal For Illustrating & Detailing, Professional Quality, 0700671
title: Beautiful colors & the best White Pencil I've ever found!
review: These have to be one of my new favorite colored pencils ever.  I've been a colored pencil artist for over 30 years, I even still have a few of my 1980s Berol/prismacolor out of print colored pencils.  I use A lot of different brands from Caran D'Ache to Schpirerr Farben & Castle Art on the lower range pencils.  I have several Derwent colored pencils & when I saw the muted tones of these drawing pencils I had to try them & I fell in love instantly!First, they are the typical Derwent pencil with the thick lead & nice heafty round barrel.  They go on so smoothly & they are a soft lead.  You can get beautiful blends with these pencils & the Chinese white that comes in this set is the best white I have ever used!  I love this white!  I even bought the small 5 piece set just to get an extra white!  The colors will compliment any of the other Derwent sets & any other set for that matter.  I've used them with my Prismas, Castle Arts, Caran D'Ache, Black Widows & Polychromos & they worked great with all of them!

title: Gutes Preis Leistungsverhältnis
review: Die Lieferung war wie immer schnell und problemlos.Beim Auspacken der Ware war kein unangenehmer Geruch festzustellen. Die Farben sind sehr schön und für kleinere Kinderhände sehr gut geeignet, da sie etwas dicker als übliche Holzmalstifte sind. Zudem sind sie nicht so lang. Die Farben sind kräftig und lassen sich leicht, ohne großen Druck zu Papier bringen. Ideal für kleine Malanfänger. Einen Stern Abzug, da die Spitzen der Stifte schnell abbrechen, sobald sie auf den Boden fallen. Also sollte ein Spitzer beim Malen griffbereit sein. Das stört unsere Kinder jedoch nicht und daher eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

prod_name: Triangular Colouring Pencil - STABILO Trio thick short - Pack of 12 - Assorted Colours
title: STABILO Trio thick - La scelta perfetta per le prime avventure artistiche della mia bimba di 2 anni!
review: Non potrei essere più soddisfatto dell'astuccio STABILO Trio thick da 24 colori che ho acquistato per la mia bimba di 2 anni. Questi pastelli sono stati un vero e proprio successo nelle sue prime avventure artistiche, e non posso che elogiare la loro qualità e versatilità.Fin dal momento in cui ho aperto l'astuccio, ho potuto percepire la cura e l'attenzione nei dettagli che STABILO ha messo in questi pastelli. Il design ergonomico e la forma triangolare sono perfetti per le manine piccole della mia bimba. Ha potuto afferrare i pastelli con facilità e iniziare a sperimentare senza problemi.La gamma di colori è semplicemente sbalorditiva. I colori sono vibranti e luminosi, catturando immediatamente l'attenzione e stimolando la creatività della mia bimba. La varietà di tonalità consente di creare opere d'arte vivaci e fantasiose, anche per una piccola artista in erba.Una delle caratteristiche che ho trovato particolarmente preziose è la resistenza dei pastelli. La punta spessa e robusta resiste bene alle pressioni più energiche, perfetta per un bambino di 2 anni che potrebbe essere un po' troppo entusiasta con la sua creatività. Ho notato che i pastelli sono durevoli e non si rompono facilmente, anche quando vengono applicate forti pressioni.La facilità con cui i pastelli si stendono sulla carta è un altro punto a favore. La morbidezza del tratto consente alla mia bimba di colorare in modo uniforme e senza sforzi e ha reso il suo processo di apprendimento artistico molto più gratificante.Inoltre, ho apprezzato la facilità con cui i colori si lavano dalla pelle e dai vestiti. Questo è un grande vantaggio quando si tratta di materiali artistici per i più piccoli.In conclusione, l'astuccio STABILO Trio thick da 24 colori è stata una scelta eccezionale per introdurre la mia bimba di 2 anni nel mondo dell'arte. La qualità, la varietà di colori e la facilità d'uso lo rendono uno strumento perfetto per stimolare la sua creatività e offrire ore di divertimento. Consiglio vivamente questi pastelli a tutti i genitori in cerca di un'opzione affidabile e di alta qualità per le prime esperienze artistiche dei loro bambini.Se hai trovato la mia recensione utile utilizza il tasto qui sotto.

title: Le meilleur porte-mine du marché
review: C’est un porte mine assez lourd, entièrement métallique, qui ne présente aucun jeu et qui est totalement rigide, ce qui le place parmi les porte-mines professionnel les plus précis du marché. Son design est éprouvé depuis de longues années. Son grip est excellent. La mécanique est fiable et la couleur bleue électrique de cette version est particulièrement réussie.

prod_name: rOtring 600 Mechanical Pencil | 0.7 mm | Blue All-Metal Body Propelling Pencil | Non-Slip Knurled Grip & Hexagonal Barrel
title: Endlich! Danke an rOtring und AMAZON!
review: Endlich, heute ist er eingetroffen mein erster nicht schwarzer und auch nicht silberner rOtring.Ein Auge hatte ich lange schon darauf. Aber da ich immer zweifelte habe ich gewartet. Bis zu diesem tollen Angebot am "Schwarzen Freitag".Da musste ich mir den Roten 600 Bleistift 0,5 holen. Dank a AMAZON zu einem unschlagbaren Preis und dank rOtring in der bewährten rOtring-Qualität.Ein absolutes muss so ein rOtring 600 - egal in welcher Farbe, das Schreib- und Zeichengefühl mit diesem perfekten Stift ist einzigartig.Nach dieser Erfahrung werden wohl in der Zukunft hoffentlich auch bald der Blaue und der Grüne in meinem Besitz sein.Diesen Stift kann ich mit gutem Geissen weiter empfehlen.Wer noch ein Geschenk sucht ist mit einem rOtring 600 auf der sicheren Seite.

prod_name: rOtring 600 Mechanical Pencil | 0.7 mm | Blue All-Metal Body Propelling Pencil | Non-Slip Knurled Grip & Hexagonal Barrel
title: Ein sehr guter Druckbleistift
review: Ich übe sehr viel Druck aus, wenn ich was mit einem Druckbleistift schreibe. Und die Mine von DM 0,5mm bricht ständig.  Seit ich diesen Druckbleistift benutze, kann ich an einem Stück viel länger schreiben.  Der 600 er liegt viel besser in der Hand als der 500 er. Die Investition hat sich echt gelohnt.

prod_name: rOtring 600 Mechanical Pencil | 0.7 mm | Blue All-Metal Body Propelling Pencil | Non-Slip Knurled Grip & Hexagonal Barrel
title: 2 porte-mine Rotring…un brisé, l’autre nouveau
review: Utilisation courante. J’ai obstrué la sortie de mine de mon premier Rotring et je n’ai pu le récupérer.C’est la raison pour laquelle j’ai commandé la pièce de remplacement et j’ai requis la même couleur.J’utilise l’un avec des mines noires et l’autre avec des mines rouges.Si j’avais réfléchi j’aurais commandé la sortie de mines d’une autre couleur pour pouvoir distinguer à vue le porte-mine qui écrit en rouge.Sinon très satisfait du produit quoique la livraison a pris beaucoup de tps.

prod_name: rOtring 600 Mechanical Pencil | 0.7 mm | Blue All-Metal Body Propelling Pencil | Non-Slip Knurled Grip & Hexagonal Barrel
title: Quality feel, nice balance and great to write with
review: Seen this on offer and sucummbed to the temptation!  It is pricy but when it is on offer it is ideal.I like Rotring pens/pencils and I find that they are nice to write with.  The only problem I have had with previous pencils is that the nib mechanisim seems to fail with me.  Bit early for this one but I'm hoping the 600 works with no issues and lasts me a long time.The pencil is all metal and has a nice weight/feel to it with the weight more towards the nib.  The gnarled surface at the nib end is just the right size when holding it.  I bought the 0.5mm which I prefer to write with.At the other end it has a rotator selector for different types of lead; 2H, 4H, 2B, B, HB, F, H.  I guess you select these depending on the size of lead you end up putting in it.I bought the green, it is quite dark which is great - could be describes as a forest green?I liked it so much I ended up buying a 600 pen to go with it.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 July 2021

Deseaba un rotring para mi coleccion de lapices ya  que soy dibujante y este modelo definitivamente me ha satisfecho . Recomendado si prefiere lapiceros delgados a los gruesos .

prod_name: rOtring 600 Mechanical Pencil | 0.7 mm | Blue All-Metal Body Propelling Pencil | Non-Slip Knurled Grip & Hexagonal Barrel
title: Perfekt
review: Mein "alter" Rotring Druckbleistift von 1985 hat endgültig seinen Dienst eingestellt,also musste ein neuer her.Nach kurzer Recherche bin ich wieder bei Rotring gelandet.  0,7mm weil mir das zum schreiben, zeichnen und markieren einfach besser taugt. Mit 54 sind die 0,2mm mehr zum 0,5er schon ein Plus.Haptik ist Spitze, der Stift hält sich super, nichts stört, nichts drückt auch nach längerem halten.Die Mechanik funktioniert geschmeidig, nichts hakt, geht schwer oder blockiert.Mir gefällt das Gewicht in Vergleich zu den leichten Plastikstiften.Metal ist einfach Metal, selbst wenn der Energieaufwand höher ist macht es seine Haltbarkeit Nachhaltig.

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: Derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: Mz Nina, business consultant and aspiring artist
review: I looove this brand, also all their colored pencil lines.  I know everyone is Prismacolor crazy, but it is hype.  Derwents are just as good and I am a little partial to them simply they are the ones I learn to draw with even as a kid.  I remember my first Derwent kit that Dad bought me, 120 pencils and I was around 8 and we were livi9ng in Australia.I love the water color pencils, the graphite, the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays, and the color soft line.  I also have a few others, but those are my favorites.I would say there pencils are as good as any other including Prismacolor.Just make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use.  Get a Derwent battery operated, which is still made or a Panasonic or a used HUNT-Boston, all of which are no longer made.  DO NOT GET X-ACTO, it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the lead.INFO ON ELECTRIC PENCIL SHARPENERS:I am a color pencil artist, and you need to have either a Panasonic, "Hunt-Boston" pencil sharpener, otherwise your colored pencils are eaten.  NEVER BUY X-ACTO for colored pencils, X-ACTO will eat your pencils.  Until you can find a Panasonic or Hunt-Boston, or Hunt or Boston electric pencil sharpener, get this if you can find one, or the Derwent "BLACK" model as it had 2 holes, one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip.  I have both.  I had bought the Derwent one as I have Derwent but also use Prismacolor and graphite.  Panasonic and Hunt Boston are NO LONGER MADE no matter WHAT anyone says.  I was lucky to buy a new PANASONIC electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until I found on.  Bought a used Boston, model #18, used on eBay and paid waaaay too much.  It was pretty beaten up.Also, if you do buy used, get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra, I would say up to $35.  I personally would not spend more than that.  I paid $38 for my new Panasonic.Also, X-ACTO bought out "Hunt-Boston" and all new models are a 4 digit model number, the actual "Hunt-Boston" is only a 2 digit.  This issue is that X-ACTO still sells under the Hunt Boston name, and it is misleading as it now uses X-ACTO cutters, which do NOTHING but EAT your pencils.  I also do not like it when someone lies about what they are selling.I bought what I thought was a "HUNT" electric pencil sharpener, it came in a box that had the Hunt name and packaging, but when I opened it up it was a, you guessed right...  An X-ACTO!!  Said so right on the sharpener.Bought on line here at Amazon from Overstock.com, but I returned it and got a refund, including shipping as they were misleading.Hope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist.  Get a PANASONIC, HUNT-BOSTON or Derwent sharpener.Also, run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2013

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: Very good pencils, one frustrating flaw...
review: Great set of quality sketching pencils which do what they say on the tin. Four stars for a couple of reasons: they were not packaged brilliantly so subjected to some force during delivery. This may result in the soft leads being broken inside the pencils, time will tell. Secondly, and this may seem a bit picky, the wave pattern on the bottom of each pencil doesn’t line up when in the tin and the name is pointing upwards. For an artist this is really frustrating and looks messy! You can either have a wave pattern going across the bottom of the tin nicely or the pencil names showing but not both. It’s really annoying but if things like that don’t bother you, you can’t go wrong with the actual pencils.

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: 9h softer than 8h, otherwise perfect pencils.
review: So I did swatches of all the pencils I received (bought 12 hard and 12 soft sets) and was surprised at how dark 9h looked. I then start a swatch with 8h and it was much lighter. I thought maybe I just pressed lighter on the 8h, I continued with the rest of the pencils, and everything was perfect. So I did more comparisons of 8h and 9h with drawing lines, different shading, etc, and 9h is definitely darker than 8h, but whatever, I at least now know what to expect from both those pencils, probably just a lull in quality assurance that day. So a star off for that, butt other than that, great pencils, will buy again for their great price and (hopefully more reliable) quality.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 December 2015

prod_name: Derwent34214 Graphic Medium Graphite Drawing Pencils, Set of 12, Professional Quality, Black
title: 前買った時よりマシになっている。
review: 以前６本セット缶を購入したが、「芯がボキボキ折れてまともに削れない」（実質使用不可能）という恐るべき低劣品質だった。今回缶デザインがリニューアル、もしかして品質も改善されているかもと購入してみた。ら、今のところ削っても折れない（！！）缶自体、かつての６本缶のペラい質感のものよりしっかりしているし、缶のプリント塗装も上質な感じ。蓋の下、鉛筆の上からラッピングされており、固定されてガチャつかず輸送されてきたのも勝因か。ダーウェントはヨーロッパメーカー（カランダッシュ除く）的に乾いた手応え、ステッドラーより肌理は粗め。が、粗過ぎない適度な肌理。今回H硬度も試したくミディアムを選んだが、かなり粗めでひっかかりのあるH硬度。発色は薄いが肌理が粗いのでソフトに感じる。B硬度は「こんなにネットリしてたっけ？」、全体に「こんなに粗かったっけ？」な印象。ガリガリした粒子もH硬度からB硬度全てにもれなく頻繁に出るので、肌理細かい効果を求める人には全くお勧めしない。概して缶蓋の作品にあるような木炭デッサンみたいなちょっとソリッドなタッチになる（向いている）。特筆すべき注意点は、表面が滑らかな傾向にある日本的な紙には向かない（粗いくせにツルツル滑って乗りにくい）。以前買った時より鉛筆の塗装は良くなっている（２分割した木の継ぎ目が目立たないし塗装も厚めになってムラも無い）。が、木の接着がスムースではなく、電動では問題無いが小型削り器ではガタガタと無理な力がかかってささくれがち、その振動で芯が折れやすい（やはり芯はもろい）。HBでも尖らせた芯先が砕けて折れやすい。定着もズバ抜けて悪く摩擦で紙面が汚れがち。以上、品質的にはドイツ・日本・スイス製より圧倒的に劣るが、肌理のある、鉛筆向きの紙にサリサリとドライな手応えで描きたい自分的には納得づくでの買い物。ただし、缶は蝶番が無い、蓋が分離するタイプ。さらに携帯すると中が偏ってバラバラになり不便。こういった缶の仕様だし、芯もあいかわらず強くはないので衝撃には注意したほうがいい。（使用始めで主に硬い硬度中心に使っているので、B硬度に使用に耐える強度があるのかは疑心暗鬼。使い物にならないようなら追記します）★ ちなみに下位ラインの『アカデミー』シリーズは違う（恐らく中国製）が、こちらは英国製。

review: This product only took a day to deliver. I also live in Canada, so that might be different for others. The graphite is pretty resistant to breaking, lays down graphite smoothly, and is pretty dark. It's not the darkest or smoothest I've drawn with, but it is super affordable. The overall quality of the pencils are still very good, artist quality. They're great for quick sketches, but excel in detailed sketches.

prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green
title: Super Qualität
review: Die Qualität von Faber-Castell ist nach wie vor sehr überzeugend. Ich arbeite an technischen Zeichnungen und zeichne/skizziere privat sehr gerne damit. Durch die sogenannten "Fall-Druckbleistift - Minen" benötigt man keinen Spitzer, man arbeitet immer mit derselben Linienstärke. Zudem befindet sich am Ende unter dem Druckknopf ein kleiner Radiergummi. Dieser ist mir erst nach längerem Gebrauch aufgefallen und wirklich praktisch.Wer auf Qualität setzen möchte ist hier genau am richtigen Produkt! Lediglich die 3,5mm Minen brechen sehr schnell, wenn man diese zu weit herausfährt oder zu feste aufdrückt. Da diese sehr dünn sind und man da sich etwas an sanfteres Zeichnen gewöhnen muss einen Stern Abzug, nichtsdestotrotz ein sehr empfehlenswertes Produkt.

prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green
title: Great Faber-Castell leads once one of the mechanical issue was sorted out.
review: Pack of three Mechanical pencils. The 0.7 and 0.5 work fine. The 0.35 was problematic. The lead (graphite) inside constantly broke when pressing the top to reveal more of the 0.35 lead, and it intermittently slipped back into the barrel of the pencil when you finally get the lead to emerge and put it to paper. I Had to remove bits of the broken lead (and the other two leads inside the pencil), make sure no small lengths left inside, then very carefully insert a single 0.35 lead and started again. This problem seems to be solved - so far - now that there is only one 0.35 lead in the pencil. This is a mechanical issue, not the leads in the pencils. These are excellent and produce smooth and consistent marks on the paper used. In conclusion: Initial disappointment from usual excellent Faber-Castell products but will monitor and report back.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 April 2021

prod_name: Faber-Castell TK-Fine-9760 Mechanical Pencils Wallet of 3 - 0.35, 0.5, 0.7mm, Green

Va genial para escribir, las minas no se parten, y el tacto es bueno, estoy seguro de que me durara una burrada de tiempo.

Anche se il mio portamine preferito, che uso ormai (questo è il terzo cambio) da circa 15 anni è il modello grip che costa 3 volte meno.
